119001.name: Warhammer 40,000: Dawn of War – Imperial Guard Edition
119001.description:
User Summary

The "Warhammer 40,000: Dawn of War: Imperial Guard Edition" not only features both the award winning "Warhammer 40,000: Dawn of War - Game of the Year" edition, but also the expansion "Warhammer 40,000: Dawn of War - Winter Assault".

As a special, this bundle also contains a limited dog tag, sporting the "Dawn of War" logo on the one, and the imperial eagle on the other side.

119003.name: Gildenbrief (Issue 35 - Jul 1995)
119003.description: This issue contains the adventure "Das Gespenst von Caer Pwyll"

119004.name: Snapshots: A Missionary Card Game
119004.description:
A second game by the Church Missionary Society, educating people about their work around the world.

The game is played rather like Happy Families in that you must ask a player of your choice for a card from a set that you already a card in that set. Eventually all 12 sets will have been completed. Now the game uses its educational purpose as players need to know something about the territory related to a set. Reference sheets are provided for the sort of information required. If information is not forthcoming, or the information provided is incorrect, the player loses that set. This continues until all sets have been 'challenged' and the winner of the game is the player with the most sets.

119005.name: Woody Woodpecker
119005.description:
It’s time for high flying mischief and crazy tricks with your favorite feathered friend! Join Woody Woodpecker and his pals as they race across green valleys and icy slopes. Speed past your opponents and grab first place by timing your touches just right. Created by renowned cartoonist Walter Lanz, the unforgettable animated collection comes to life in this addictive and hilarious racing game that’s fun for all ages.


Game Features
-Based on the all-time classic animations by Walter Lanz.
-Choose to play from famous Walter Lantz characters.
-Simple controls that are easy to master.
-Race against people from all over the world using Wi-Fi based multi-player mode.
-Original music created by renowned composer, David Ari Leon.
-Wildly entertaining game for all ages.

Source: The Publisher Website.

119006.name: Direct Hit: Missile War
119006.description:
Game uses fresh solution in RTS genre - separated player's map, and lack of classic units, their role is played by a pseudo units. A randomly generated landscape provides a unique map every time when player start new level, which gives the opportunity to play the game forever. The success of a player depends not only on the successful military operations, but also on proper economic development. This feature of missions strategic planning increases the playability and main interest in the game. Game has low system requirements with excellent 2D graphics and rich sound. Violent-free. The destruction of enemy buildings does not have a destructive impact on the psychological consciousness of the player. The game is suitable for publishing on markets of all countries.

Source: The Publisher Website.

119007.name: Walking the Dragon
119007.description:
From the rules:

Players each start the game with a "child" card placed face up in his or her own play area.

On a player's turn, he or she draws one card from the face-down draw pile. If the card is a dragon's tail, the player may place it next to the child card; if not, the card is discarded. Once a tail card has been placed, future draws of a dragon's body or dragon's head are allowed to be (and must be) played next to the tile, whereas future draws of a tail are then discarded. Drawing a dragon's head completes a dragon.

After completing a dragon, the player, on his or her next turn, make take another child card, if any remain, and begin anew the process of attempting to create the longest dragon.

If the draw pile is exhausted, the discard pile is shuffled to form a new draw pile.

The game ends when sufficient cards have been drawn and placed such that no further legal plays can be made. The winner is the player who created the longest dragon.

119008.name: Spot It!
119008.description: Children's game to keep them occupied on a long car journey. Each child id dealt some cards (the number could vary depending on the time available). Then it is a simple mechanic of spotting one of the items on the cards in their hand. First to spot all the cards in their hand, wins.

119009.name: Gildenbrief (Issue 36 - Jul 1995)
119009.description: This issue contains an article about the trolls of Alba. A new class "Hexenjäger" (witchhunter) and new skills.

119010.name: Gildenbrief (Issue 37 - Dec 1995)
119010.description: This issue conatins an article about the settlement Chuquix, and a systemoverview of Midgard.

119011.name: Gildenbrief (Issue 38 - Mar 1996)
119011.description: This issue conatains the Map of KuenKung (A3) and an article of the healing order Tiumenchatictli

119012.description:
The world's most famous capital cities didn't just appear overnight. It took careful planning, resources, and time. Now, new countries seek to build great capitals of their own, and you are challenged to create a city unlike any other – but with each new era comes new challenges, and you must be prepared to make important decisions. The winning player will earn the right to host the next World Expo, but that's a prize reserved for only the most prestigious city.

The Capitals is a city-building game unlike any other, featuring new and creative game mechanisms. Cities take many years to build, and The Capitals requires players to plan ahead to create their vision. Playing over three eras, from Victorian to Modern Day, players are challenged to build a capital city that can compete with the world's best but also stand the test of time. With over one hundred unique buildings to construct, no two cities will ever be identical.

What story will your city tell?

AWARDS & HONORS
2013 HEAVY CARDBOARD “HEAVY GAME OF 2013” AWARD Nominee
119012.name: The Capitals

119013.name: The Bilestoad
119013.description:
The Bilestoad is a computer game by Marc Goodman (credited as "Mangrove Earthshoe") for the Apple II platform, released in 1982 by Datamost.

In The Bilestoad, players control "meatlings" that hack and battle with axes and shields from a top-view perspective. The name is derived from the German words Beil (axe) and Tod (death). The odd spelling reflects Goodman's idea of a future language similar to A Clockwork Orange's Nadsat in which English has been modified by the borrowing of foreign words. Although the game may seem medieval, the backstory in the manual explains that the axe fighting is actually a future virtual reality game designed to reduce real violence.

The Bilestoad allows a human player to fight against either a computer-controlled opponent or another human. One can also pit two robots against each other. Movement and combat is accomplished with the keyboard, pressing keys to swing the gladiator's axe or shield outwards or inwards, or to make the gladiator turn, stop or walk. The game play is quite violent and bloody—players lop off their opponents' shield or sword arms, and dispatch them by decapitation.

The arena of combat is a small island, maps of which (at short, medium, and long range) are shown at the right side of the screen. Scattered around the arena are various objects, including yin/yang discs which players can stand on to accelerate their movement, stars that transport players to other points in the arena, and "faces" that allow players to leave the level. The game offers more strategic variation than many fighting games, letting the player run away and be chased around the island. The musical soundtrack begins with a bizarre, ponderous, off-key re-working of Beethoven's "Für Elise".

According to the author, influences for The Bilestoad include the movie Excalibur and Monty Python and the Holy Grail.

Source: Wikipedia, "The Bilestoad", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

videogame.118157: Uncharted 2: Among Thieves Game of the Year Edition

119014.name: Uncharted Dual Pack

videogamefranchise.6404: Greatest Hits (Best Selling PlayStation Games, US)

videogamecompilation.118157: Uncharted 2: Among Thieves Game of the Year Edition

119014.description:
User Summary

Uncharted Greatest Hits Combo pack includes
- Uncharted: Drakes Fortune Greatest Hits edition
- Uncharted 2: Among Thieves Game of the Year edition

Also included is a Souper Voucher to redeem DLC bonus material for both Uncharted 2 and Uncharted 3.

119015.name: Kujibiki Unbalance: Kaicho Onegai Smash Fight
119015.description:
Kujibiki Unbalance: Kaichō Onegai Smash Fight is based on the 2006 anime series of Kujibiki Unbalance.

Source: Wikipedia, "Kujibiki Unbalance: Kaicho Onegai Smash Fight", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

Kujibiki♥Unbalance (くじびき♥アンバランス Kujibiki♥Anbaransu), also referred to as Kujibiki "Heart" Unbalance in order to differentiate it from its original incarnation, is a 12-episode Fall 2006 anime series created by Shimoku Kio.

Source: Wikipedia, "Kujibiki Unbalance (2006 series)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

In this relationship/adventure game, your 'liked' level determines how well you do in battle as much as the two girl allies you choose. The three of you navigate a maze and battle various enemies in order to reach one of 50 different endings.

Source: The Game Website.

119016.name: Was wird hier falsch gemacht?
119016.description:
Objective: be the first to reach finish line
learn traffic signs/rules
- acting by turn -
roll the die - ending on a marked/numbered space follow instruchtions printed cover inside
remarks:
pewter meeples - late 40's/early 50's

119017.name: Baseball Game
119017.description: Spinner game from McLoughlin Brothers. Spin the spinner and look for the results.

119018.name: Stupid Fantasy Laws, Vol. 1
119018.description:
From Introduction:

Based on both the superstitions of the past and the inactive laws still written on the books throughout the real world comes Stupid Fantasy Laws, Volume 1. In this role playing product you will find a dozen different laws that are based on the erratic judgment of rulers, the irrational fears of villagers, oppressive social customs, and the unusual outcomes of very seldom occurring situations. From the black cat possession law to the fines of shaving or trimming one’s hair during a full moon there are a dozen laws in this volume of Stupid Fantasy Laws designed to cause local villagers and adventuring characters alike a considerable amount of trouble, grief, and hardship. So much trouble, grief, and hardship, in fact, that it is liable to keep the adventurers from wandering into a nearby village or town for weeks to come.

119019.name: Stupid Fantasy Laws, Vol. 2
119019.description:
From Introduction:

Based on both the superstitions of the past and the inactive laws still written on the books throughout the real world comes Stupid Fantasy Laws, Volume 2. In this role playing product you will find a dozen different laws that are based on the erratic judgment of rulers, the irrational fears of villagers, oppressive social customs, and the unusual outcomes of very seldom occurring situations. From the ban of individuals with six fingers or toes on their hands or feet to the punishments of being caught wearing armor within the community limits unauthorized there are a dozen laws in this volume of Stupid Fantasy Laws designed to cause local villagers and adventuring characters alike a considerable amount of trouble, grief, and hardship. So much trouble, grief, and hardship, in fact, that it is liable to keep the adventurers from wandering into a nearby village or town for weeks to come.

119020.name: Stupid Fantasy Laws, Vol. 3
119020.description:
From Introduction:

Based on both the superstitions of the past and the inactive laws still written on the books throughout the real world comes Stupid Fantasy Laws, Volume 3. In this role playing product you will find a dozen different laws that are based on the erratic judgment of rulers, the irrational fears of villagers, oppressive social customs, and the unusual outcomes of very seldom occurring situations. From the tragic deaths caused by a law banning births during a blue moon to the punishments of being caught discussing various elements of the supernatural there are a dozen laws in this volume of Stupid Fantasy Laws designed to cause local villagers and adventuring characters alike a considerable amount of trouble, grief, and hardship. So much trouble, grief, and hardship, in fact, that it is liable to keep the adventurers from wandering into a nearby village or town for weeks to come.

119021.name: Stupid Fantasy Laws, Vol. 4
119021.description:
From Introduction:

Based on both the superstitions of the past and the inactive laws still written on the books throughout the real world comes Stupid Fantasy Laws, Volume 4. In this role playing product you will find a dozen different laws that are based on the erratic judgment of rulers, the irrational fears of villagers, oppressive social customs, and the unusual outcomes of very seldom occurring situations.

119022.name: Stupid Fantasy Laws, Vol. 5
119022.description:
From Introduction:

Based on both the superstitions of the past and the inactive laws still written on the books throughout the real world comes Stupid Fantasy Laws, Volume 5. In this role playing product you will find a dozen different laws that are based on the erratic judgment of rulers, the irrational fears of villagers, oppressive social customs, and the unusual outcomes of very seldom occurring situations. From requiring every family living in the village to own a raft or a boat to the punishments of being caught carrying around a patched bag or sack there are a dozen laws in this volume of Stupid Fantasy Laws designed to cause local villagers and adventuring characters alike a considerable amount of trouble, grief, and hardship. So much trouble, grief, and hardship, in fact, that it is liable to keep the adventurers from wandering into a nearby village or town for weeks to come.

119023.name: Stupid Fantasy Laws, Vol. 6
119023.description:
From Introduction:

Based on both the superstitions of the past and the inactive laws still written on the books throughout the real world comes Stupid Fantasy Laws, Volume 6. In this role playing product you will find a dozen different laws that are based on the erratic judgment of rulers, the irrational fears of villagers, oppressive social customs, and the unusual outcomes of very seldom occurring situations.

119024.name: Stupid Fantasy Laws, Vol. 7
119024.description:
From Introduction:

While murder, rape, exploitation, theft, and abuse are certainly novel selections for crimes appropriately punished these infractions against society are rather… well, terribly bland and a bit too straight to the point. So straight to the point, in fact, that any true, red blooded village wracked with superstitious idealizations should have little to fear from the threat of such obvious crimes. Real villages and communities need crimes rooted from pathetic inner fears. Real villages need stupid, oppressive laws.

With this in mind we bring you yet another installment of the popular Stupid Fantasy Laws series. In this edition you will find well over a dozen new laws that are designed to hinder the characters as they attempt to interact with civilization.

119025.name: Urban Events
119025.description:
From Introduction:

From adventure worthy hooks to single encounters, the villages, towns, and cities that the characters visit are ripe with opportunity. Whether its trying to calm down a sick, erratic behaving unicorn or saving a rich individual from a brutal mugging, this collection of events and hooks is full of urban adventure.

119026.description:
Spair is a very simple two players game playable with two Shibumi game systems. It uses two 4×4 boards, and two whole sets of balls.

Rules
The board starts empty. Two players take turns placing a ball of one color on the first board (called A), and then a ball of another color on the second board (called B), according to the following rules:
1) a ball may be placed on a board if its color is different from the color of the ball that has been placed on the same board in the previous turn and
2) a player must place a ball of the color not placed by the opponent in the previous turn.

Balls may be placed either on empty board holes or stacking on 2x2 platforms of existing balls.

A player wins when a full line of any single color is made, orthogonally or diagonally, on any level on his board: board B for the first player and board A for the second player.

Lines on the 4x4 (board) level must be of length 4, lines on the 3x3 level must be of length 3, and lines on the 2x2 level must be of length 2.
119026.name: Spair

119027.name: Art of Balance
119027.description:
User Summary

Art of Balance is a block-stacking, physics-based puzzle game with 100 levels distributed across four "worlds." The goal of each level is to stack a series of blocks so that they don't fall over. The blocks come in several shapes and the contours of the initial base vary as well. Later levels introduce new kinds of blocks (for example, that only support a limited amount of weight before breaking), and each world contains some special challenge levels (for example, creating a stack of a certain height).

119028.name: Thorn: Zombie Dungeon Survival
119028.description:
User Summary

In Thorn: Zombie Dungeon Survival you control Thorn, a badass Viking hero. Your goal is to survive through a maze filled with zombies, for this task you have axes, blades and explosives.

The game offers a Survival mode and an Escape Mode.

119029.name: Tower Defense: Lost Earth
119029.description:
"Earth needs resources as it expands into a new world in deep space. But there’s something—or someone—else out there…Protect Earth’s last hope in the long-awaited Tower Defense for your iPhone, iPod Touch, and iPad! We are proud to announce that our definitive tower defense title, Tower Defense: Lost Earth, is now available on the iTunes App Store!

Journey to the future with the last expedition from earth as they battle to gather resources and defend humanity on a hostile alien planet with endless waves of enemies. With over 40 campaigns, 6 challenge maps, and 5 world maps encompassing mountain ranges, ice lands, lava terrain and more, Tower Defense: Lost Earth is the absolute tower defense game. Polish and style define 4 game play modes, 10 types of enemies, 4 weapons and up to 9 tower types, with many more in DLC upgrades coming soon.

Follow mankind’s last chance for survival, and hold fast against the waves of enemies with strategy and strength. Brag about your high scores and unrelenting defenses with Facebook and Twitter integration. Take the challenge with you wherever you play with an optimized universal version for your iPad as well. Save the future of humanity today!"

Source: The Developer Website.

119030.name: Warmen Tactics
119030.description:
User Summary

Warmen Tactics is an on-rails, light-gun style shooter in a near-future setting. The premise of the game that the United Nations' "Department of Control" is using top-secret military technology to create a single, world-wide police state. The player is part of a Resistance that opposes this.

119031.name: Warfare Incorporated
119031.description:
"Experience Warfare Incorporated, the critically acclaimed and best selling mobile real time strategy (RTS) game of all time!!! Build your forces to defend and control the newly discovered planet Icarus, with its astounding mineral wealth and mysterious alien artifacts.

Features:

Fully touch optimized for iPhone, iPod Touch, Palm, and PocketPC!
Play single player and multiplayer!
22 unit and structure types, 2 alien landscapes
41 built-in single and multiplayer missions
350+ add-on single and multiplayer missions
Online multiplayer with lobby, game rooms, player chat
Leaderboard, game history, and player statistics
Full PC based mission editor - create and publish your own missions!
"

Source: The Game Website.

119032.name: Envoyer (Issue 99 - Jan 2005)
119032.description: This issue contains an adventure for vampire "Schattenherrschaft"

119033.name: Envoyer (Issue 100 - Feb 2005)
119033.description: This issue contains the DSA adventure "Hundertfache Wahrheit"

119034.name: Envoyer (Issue 101 - Mar 2005)
119034.description: This issue conatians an Engel adventure "Gloriels Geschenk"

119035.name: Envoyer (Issue 102 - Apr 2005)
119035.description: This issue contains an Earthdawn adventure "Illusionen!"

119036.name: Temporal Probability Agency: To Predict and Serve Act 1: A Function of Probability
119036.description:
From the web site:

The players are minding their own business, enjoying a trip home from a tropical vacation, when probability knocks.

Take on hijackers a mile in the sky and safely bring the plane to a landing.
Get into a fight with Mall Security and steal a bunch of Rolexs.
Take on the Italian Mafia to prevent the murder of a labor leader.

119037.name: Envoyer (Issue 103 - May 2005)
119037.description: This issue conatins a legend of the five rings adventure "Schwarzer Reis"

119038.name: The Man-At-Arms Advanced Class
119038.description:
From Introduction:

The Man-At-Arms is a mounted mercenary, a knight for hire. Throughout the Middle Ages and the Renaissance, these were the noble equivalent of the professional infantry which rulers hired when marching to war. Unlike a knight, the Man-At-Arms does not follow a code of honor, save for that of the contract and the purse. Some Men-At-Arms might prove loyal to a single employer, following a king or other patron with devotion. Still, even these men of virtue receive coin for their troubles.

119039.name: The Mercenary Advanced Class
119039.description:
From Introduction:

In many instances, mercenary soldiers through the Medieval and Renaissance periods were the dredges of society — criminals, vagabonds, and the destitute. However, the best of the professional companies had soldiers of exceptional ability. They could face the best in the field and triumph. The Swiss pike and the German Landsknecht are examples of trained and capable mercenary infantry.

119040.name: The Spy Advanced Class
119040.description:
From Introduction:

The Spy of the High Middle Ages and Renaissance is not the equivalent of the modern spy or secret agent employed by the nation-state. The Spy is as likely to be a merchant who trades regularly with a foreign country as a professional hunter of secrets. Spy networks of the Middle Ages and Renaissance were no less complex than in modern times, but due to the difficulties of communications over long distances, and the lack of aerial or satellite reconnaissance, the secrets which the Spy seeks may be as mundane as how many troops in a particular army. In modern times, this knowledge is accessible to the general public through certain periodicals or information archives. In the past, often a king did not know the precise numbers of his army.

119041.name: Envoyer (Issue 104 - Jun 2005)
119041.description: This issue contains a Mondagor adventure "Das Vermächtnis des Wirkers". And the ultra light rules for PROST, which can be seperated from the issue.

119042.name: Envoyer (Issue 105 - Jul 2005)
119042.description: This issue contains the Shadowrun adventure "Zwei Kurze für die Jungs im Schatten"

119043.name: Envoyer (Issue 106 - Aug 2005)
119043.description: This issue contains the Discworld adventure "Graue Töne"

119044.name: Whispers of Death: A Sourcebook for Assassin Characters
119044.description:
From publisher blurb:

Murderous whispers heard in the dead of night, a poisoned arrow fired upon it's target through the busy streets of the city, a dark figure that seems to emerge from the shadows behind it's prey, the unannounced guest that slips poison into his host's wine, and the warrior who uses deception to deal death blows upon his enemies. These are the many faces of the assassin. Within the pages of this book you will find:

Five new prestige classes for assassins covering mastery in the different assassin styles.
New feats designed for assassin characters.
New assassin and shadowblade spells.
New paths: Class combinations that outline career paths for assassin characters to take.
Four detailed assassin guilds.
New equipment, weapons, and armor for assassin characters.
Assassin-specific magical items.
Assassin Styles: techniques assassins can learn without taking levels in additional prestige classes.
Guidelines for compensating assassin characters who complete jobs.

119045.name: The Whispers of Death Companion
119045.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to the Whispers of Death Companion. This product is designed to supplement Whispers of Death: A Sourcebook for Assassin Characters. If you do not own this book, a lot of the content in this supplement will be of no use.

This supplement contains a few things that were left out of Whispers of Death, particularly new rules for poisons. This supplement also contains an example assassin encounter as well as a variant on the rules to compensating assassin characters for jobs.

119046.name: Rugby 06
119046.description:
Rugby 06 is the 2006 release in the Rugby series by EA Sports. The game allows players to play as many Rugby nations, both major and minor, and includes many tournaments, such as the Rugby World Cup, the Tri Nations, the Six Nations, and the Super 14.

Source: Wikipedia, "Rugby 06", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

119047.name: Envoyer (Issue 107 - Sep 2005)
119047.description: This issue contains 2 short adventures for superheroes RPGs "Böse ist, wer Böses tut"

119048.name: Epic Whispers of Death
119048.description:
From publisher blurb:

The new edition of the core rulebooks gives information on advancing characters beyond 20th level. This document provides the epic level progressions for three of the 10 level prestige classes from the Whispers of Death: A Sourcebook for Assassin Characters book: Shadowblade, Slayer, and Sniper. Characters must be at least 20th level to advance to 11th level in any of these prestige classes. Each class improves on its previous abilities, but gains no new abilities. Some abilities hit maximum power at or before 10th level and do not increase in power after 10th level. In addition to enhancing previous abilities, all epic assassins receive bonus feats as noted on each epic progression.

119049.name: Envoyer (Issue 108 - Oct 2005)
119049.description: This issue contains to short Cthulhu adventures: "Cthuloides Allerei; Das Kinder der Tiefe & Das Buch der Toten Namen"

119050.name: Envoyer (Issue 109 - Nov 2005)
119050.description: This issue contains the Deadlands adventure "Ein Herz für Zombies". It also contains the light rules for Elek-Mantow, which can be seperated from the issue.

119051.name: The Punisher (DOS)
119051.description:
From back of the game box

They call me The Punisher, because I dispense the dark side of justice the side that doesn't care for Miranda Rights, search warrants or circumstantial evidence. Members of the underworld killed my family and got away with it. I'm settling the score.

And I get paid to do it. A clandestine group finances my missions because I accomplish what the justice system can't. I eliminate drug dealers, expose corruption - I terrorize the terrorists themselves. I'm a professional vigilante, and I work in Manhattan, where many consider me a hero.

But I've got enemies. One of them is seven feet tall and weighs 450 pounds. His name is Kingpin and he's New York's undisputed head of organized crime. I've terminated his best assassins time and time again.

Now I've got a chance to nail Kingpin himself. For $500,000, an informant will reveal the fat man's location. It's a limited-time offer, so I've got to act now. If I can complete enough missions, should be able to raise the money.

Half a million bucks. That means a lot of overtime.

Fortunately, I like my job.

-Become The Punisher as he scours Manhattan with over 50 mission options.
-Talk with characters of all kinds: terrified victims, innocent bystanders, policemen, even criminals.
-Three kinds of combat, three kinds of views:
Driving: blast enemies in The Punisher's armored Battle Van. See all the action through the Battle Van's windshield.
On foot: explore buildings, search alleyways, roam city streets with The Punisher's personal arsenal at your disposal. Top-down perspective lets you take on multiple opponents at once.
Underwater: battle criminals along the Manhattan shoreline, beneath piers or near boats docked off shore. Non-stop action viewed from the side.
-Dazzling original artwork captures the grittiness of big city crime and the people involved in it.
-From the creators of Spider-Man and Captain America in Dr. Doom's Revenge and X-Men: Madness in Murderworld.

119052.name: Xbox 360 HD-DVD Player
119052.description:
The HD DVD player connects to the Xbox 360 using a USB connection. All of the audio and video processing and output come from Xbox 360 itself. The unit can also function as a USB hub, with 2 ports on the rear. It also includes a clip for attaching the wireless network adapter to it, like on the Xbox 360 itself. The device also has an integrated 256 MB memory unit which is used for storage of HD DVD data and is accessible to the user for saving other data such as saved games.
The drive will play standard DVDs in addition to HD DVD titles; however it will not read Xbox or Xbox 360 game discs, Audio CDs or mixed media CDs. All Xbox 360 games continue to use DVD-9 media. No Xbox 360 with a built-in HD DVD drive was ever released.

Source: Wikipedia, "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Xbox_360_HD_DVD_Player,"; available under the CC-BY-SA License.

119053.name: Rice Krispies Pop Game
119053.description:
A promotional card game from Kellogg's.

A set collecting game with everyone playing at once. You call out cards you have available to swap (but not the colour) and you try to do a deal with a player who is calling out a letter you need (but, of course, it might be the wrong colour but you don't know that until you add the card to your hand.

When you have a set of three cards (that spell POP) you shout out "Pop!" and lay down the set face-up. The game stops whilst your set is checked as valid and then starts again.

The winner is the first player to lay down all their cards in valid sets.

Really, this is a simpler form of Pit.

119054.name: Envoyer (Issue 110 - Dec 2005)
119054.description: This issue contains a shadowrun christmas adventure "Stille Nacht, bleihaltige Nacht" and a double short adventure "Leise rieselt der Schnee"

119055.description:
A playful novel game that will allow you to shape your strategies in humor and friendliness. You will find Asian natural elements: Wood, Fire, Earth, Metal, Water and Air. All these elements are connected through two cycles ancestral "Shen" (lead) and "Ke" (control). The game levels are represented by belt color (yellow, orange, green, blue and red): Everyone, beginner or advanced player, can participate.

Players tell the story with playing cards and must react and interupt for other players' stories. The goal is to be the first to play all your cards on the table
119055.name: Shenke

119056.name: The Runes of Zendos
119056.description:
From the cassette inlay:

The tiny principality of DORCASIA was a pleasant fertile land until the wizard ZENDOS used his evil powers to cast the country into perpetual darkness until all citizens pledge obedience to him.

It is known that through the SPELL OF DARKNESS Zendos has trapped the spirit of each month into one of 12 GOLDEN TEMPUS RUNES or RUNIC HOUR GLASSES hidden deep within his mysterious magical castle.

As the land dies in the grip of the black desolation a hero must be found to locate and destroy the 12 hour glasses thus releasing the months and returning Dorcasia to the natural forces of the seasons.

Each glass has a RUNIC inscription around its base which you must read and understand. Only saying these words will lift that part of the spell. To protect the hour glasses Zendos has places them in 12 separate rooms in his castle, each room linked to a different exterior gateway by a devious route.

Depending on which entrance you select Zendos casts spells which change the locations of rooms within his castle to confuse you. The menacing creatures and challenging problems which confront you at every turn mean that only the brave and the clever will succeed.

119057.name: Gridrunner
119057.description:
From the back of the box

By the year 2190 the earth is a barren and desolate wasteland. With all natural resources used up, the human race's last hopes rest with a huge orbitting solar power station known as the GRID. Now the GRID has been invaded by a race of evil droids, intent on the total subjegation of earth. To combat these droids, an increddibly powerful and manouverable ship, the Gridrunner, was developed. Your mission: stop the droids and save the earth.

119058.name: The Story Core Rulebook
119058.description:
lulu.com summary:

Everyone has, in one point of time or another, played a Role-Playing Game. This is Story Teller's Version 1.5 of The Story, a 3D6 gaming system, closely related to D&D and GURPS.

119059.name: Matrix: Gridrunner 2
119059.description:
From the back of the box

Jeff Minter has taken Gridrunner - the game that topped bestseller charts in USA an UK - and created an awesome sequel. Graphically superb, it features multiple screens, new aliens and attack waves, mystery bonuses, renegade humanoids, deflexor shields, diagonal tracking, countdown/panic phase and much, much more.... Packed into 20 mind-zapping zones and accompanied by incredible sonics.

Individual Credits:
Jeff Minter - design, program

119060.name: The Blackguard Portfolio
119060.description:
From publisher blurb:

The blackguard is the prototypical bad guy, without remorse, caring not for your thoughts and feelings; only the will of their divine master is their motivation (as long as they get their cut). Nothing else matters. The epitome of a walking terror, a blackguard is the bane of anything that is good and holy.

The Blackguard Portfolio is your one-stop source for new rules and information for the blackguard prestige class. Inside you will find:

New feats, dirty tricks, spells, and magical items to make your blackguard character more menacing, or your game's blackguard NPCs more dangerous;
New artifacts for the blackguard, such as the blackguard band, which gains new powers as you gain levels;
A new incantation to turn a paladin's holy avenger sword into a weapon of spite and malice;
A new blackguard prestige class called the Sniper Blackguard that fights from range.

119061.name: Battle of Britain
119061.description:
User Summary

A early and simple RTS wargame based on the Battle of Britain. Played on a 31x20 gridded map (labelled A-e horizontally and A-T vertically), the player controls nine squadrons of airplanes patrolling the skies of south-east England in an attempt to find and destroy nine (initially hidden) computer controlled German bomber forces. Defense locations and bomber targets are randomised each game, and the game included a simple difficulty setting which affected the winning conditions (how many enemy bombers could the player allow to reach their targets).

119062.name: Laser Zone
119062.description:
Back of the Box

It is a dark time for the Terran federation. The evil empire of Irata and the develish war fiends of Zzyax are attacking all Terran outposts, including yours......
Your task is to co-ordinate the defensive fire of the two powerfull plasma cannon, each capable of destroying your enemies - or each other!. Be warned, you won't find it easy......
Laserzone is a game which demands your skill and concentration. It includes unique 'move, tilt and fire' control of the two plasma cannons, smart bombs and an attack wave countdown indicator.

119063.name: 3.6 international
119063.description:
3.6 International is a game of thirty-six cards plus three jokers. Each card has a color, tens digit and units digit. The goal is to reconstruct six families of maps showing the same characteristics.

To do this, you ask a card from opponent. But it is allowed to lie. If You are in doubt, You may ask to see the hand of the target. There will be a penalty of three cards for the liar or for you if he didn't lie.

119064.name: Quazatron
119064.description:
From the cassette inlay:

You control KLP-2 (Klepto) a wayward Meknotech droid assigned to deactivate hostile alien droids which inhabit the underground city of Quazatron on the planet Quartech. You must destroy the alien droids by laser fire, by pushing them off their programmed routes to destruction, or by ramming them (providing you are stronger than they are).

KLP-2 has a prototype Grapple device enabling the alien robots to be stopped and dismantled. The parts recovered from the aliens can be added to KLP-2 to extend his facilities and endurance.

The alien computer system can be tapped to provide maps of the various levels and obtain data on the alien droids and their constituent parts.

119065.name: History & Legends: SICILY
119065.description:
SICILY is the first game of the collection History & Legends, set between the centuries V B.C. and the IIIrd A.D.. Strategy, diplomacy and economy are combined in it, allowing to recreate the wars between Carthaginians, Greeks and Romans to get the control of the mentioned island.

It is a boardgame where can take part up to 4 players. It is structured in years, each one with its four seasons: spring, summer, autumn and winter. The game mechanics are very elaborated and allows to apply great variety of strategies. Nevertheless, learn to play is so easy and, in a few minutes, raw players can defend alone. The actions in every phase are very rapid, so games can last from 1 to 5 hours according to the select scene and it decided that the players are.

SICILY contains a great carton board and tokens, color rules, plastic miniatures, events and secret aims cards, etc... In these moments, it is only available in the language of Cervantes (spanish), but it also will be published the corresponding version in the language of Shakespeare (english).


SICILIA es el primer juego de la colección Historia y Leyendas, ambientado entre los siglos V antes de Cristo y el III después de Cristo. En él se combinan estrategia, diplomacia y economía, permitiendo recrear las guerras entre cartagineses, griegos y romanos para hacerse con el control de dicha isla.

Se trata de un juego de tablero en el que pueden participar hasta 4 jugadores por partida. Se estructura en años, cada uno con sus cuatro temporadas: primavera, verano, otoño e invierno. La mecánica de juego está muy elaborada y permite aplicar gran variedad de estrategias. Sin embargo, aprender a jugar es sencillo y en pocos minutos los jugadores novatos pueden defenderse solos. Las acciones en cada fase son muy rápidas, por lo que las partidas pueden durar de 1 a 5 horas según el escenario escogido y lo decididos que sean los participantes.

SICILIA contiene un gran tablero de cartón, un reglamento a todo color, miniaturas de plástico, fichas de cartón, cartas de sucesos y de objetivos secretos. En estos momentos solamente está disponible en el idioma de Cervantes (castellano), pero dentro de poco también publicaremos la versión correspondiente en el idioma de Shakespeare (inglés).

119066.name: Jupiter Lander
119066.description:
User Summary

Land your spacecraft on Jupiter. Land on the hard to reach platforms to get more points.

A Lunar Lander clone, developed and released by Commodore. It was the first game released for the Commodore 64.

119067.name: The Grinch
119067.description:
The Grinch is a video game based on the film Dr. Seuss' How the Grinch Stole Christmas. The game was released shortly after the film hit theaters.

On the top of Mt. Crumpit, his eye pressed to the telescope, the Grinch observes Whoville. He mumbles something that his dog Max hardly perceives: "I've got it! I have a great idea! This year, the Whos will pay!" The Grinch just despises Christmas and this year, he wants it to end. "That, in fact, is the misanthrope scheme. Build gadgets from blueprints. Halt the holiday theme". He enters into his spacious cave to decide which of his gadgets he should build first. The Grinch the blueprints include such inventions as the Rotten Egg Launcher, Slime Shooter, Binoculars, Octopus Climbing Device, Rocket Spring, Grinch Copter, and Marine Mobile. He then makes a decision, but before he can get to his gadget, he slips on one of his boxes, resulting in his blueprints getting blown out of his cave. But the Grinch doesn't let this debacle stop him. He takes out his notebook and makes a few schemes that's sure to ruin the fun for everyone.
Or so he thinks.

Source: Wikipedia, "The Grinch (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

119068.name: Radar Rat Race
119068.description:
Radar Rat Race was a 1981 game for the Commodore VIC-20, later converted to the Commodore 64. It was among thirty game titles marketed by Commodore on cartridges. It was a clone of the Namco arcade game Rally-X.

The player guides a mouse through a large maze. The camera follows the mouse and shows only a small portion of the maze at any given time. The player is pursued by at least three rats. The goal is to eat all of the pieces of cheese, shown for the entire maze on a radar screen, without getting caught by a rat or bumping into a stationary cat. By pressing the joystick button the mouse can disperse a limited amount of magical dust which confuses the rats for about five seconds.
Once the round is complete, the game starts again, with more rats and faster play.
The gameplay is accompanied by a frenetic, rhythmically altered version of a phrase from Three Blind Mice, which cycles endlessly.

Source: Wikipedia, "Radar Rat Race", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

119069.description:
Hop down the rabbit trail to pick some garden fresh veggies. But watch out! Pickles and Digger are in a playful mood. Sneak past them to bring home fresh veggies for a delicious treat!

On your turn, roll the 3 colored dice and resolve them in order:

- Blue Die: Shows which section of the garden Pickles the Farmer will visit this turn. Any rabbits in that section lose the Veggie Tile they're carrying, and must go to the farmhouse until their next turn.
- Orange Die: Shows how many spaces Digger the Dog will move around the dog run on his turn. If the dog enters a forest where a Rabbit Pawn is waiting, that rabbit drops their veggies and must return to their rabbit hole until their next turn.
- White Die: Move your Rabbit Pawn up to the number of spaces you rolled. You may stop to pick up a Veggie Tile then continue on until the number of spaces you rolled are used up. But remember...sometimes it's safer to move fewer spaces than you rolled.

Collect veggies (carrots, radishes, lettuce, or eggplants) for points -- if they're from another rabbit's corner of the garden you earn bonus points!

WHAT THEY'LL LEARN: Sequencing, Risk vs Reward, Early Counting & Math
119069.name: Pickles' Veggie Pick

119070.name: The Incredible Machine: Even More Contraptions
119070.description:
From the back of the case:

Welcome to The Incredible Machine: Even More Contraptions. Your first assignment is to create a new GIGAMAREE. Just grab a doodly-wobble and screw it to a cirum-recoiled IOKIONIC reflecting laser using a job-ratchety-thang. Then have everybody clear the room while you THROW THE SWITCH.

119071.name: Space It!
119071.description:
Draw 12 tiles and place them behind your screen. Create sequences of 3 or more tiles. First person to use all of their tiles wins the game!

During the first round, each player must open by creating a new sequence. After the first round of play, players may create more new sequences or place individual tiles.

A new sequence can be created vertically or horizontally -- in crossword fashion -- but the value between tiles in a sequence must always be equal, such as 3-7-11 (spaced by 4) or 5-12-19 (spaced by 7). TIME WARP: If a player plays a new sequence which contains one tile of each color (red, blue, and yellow), all opponents draw one random tile from the cloth bag.

After their opening turn, players may add new tiles to the front or end of an existing sequence (including another player's sequence), as long as the spacing already established for that sequence is followed. Players may also insert two or more new tiles inside an existing sequence, altering the spacing to a new value between tiles.

Players play as many tiles as possible on their turn, and if they can't play at least one tile they must draw one from the cloth bag. The first player to place all their tiles wins!

WHAT THEY'LL LEARN: Sequencing, Patterning

119072.name: Let's Drive
119072.description:
Time to hit the open road! Visit scenic locations around the USA. Earn a point for each Destination you visit, and bonuses for collecting sets!

Each player starts with 4 Destination Cards, chooses one of them for a starting location, and places their car pawn on that city. On a player's turn, their car pawn can move three times using the roads or airlines. Events or Bonus Cards may give additional moves. Announce the names of each city you visit, so other players are aware which cities have been visited.

Each time a player stops in a city shown on a "public card" or one of their Destination Cards, they add that card face-up in their scoring area and move up the scoring track.

Always pay attention during other players' turns. If another player visits a city that matches one of the cards in your hand, ask them to send you a postcard! They score the card you were holding, but you receive a card from the Postcard Deck, which is also worth a point.

After finishing your turn, draw cards from the Destination Deck to replenish your hand back to 3 cards. If an Event Card is revealed while drawing, follow the instructions on the card first, then draw a new Destination Card to replace it.

Any time a player completes a set of 3 Destination Cards and/or Postcards of the same color, they receive a Bonus Card. These cards provide bonus points or special abilities that will help you advance.

WHAT THEY'LL LEARN: Geography, Strategy, State Facts


Sequel to: Let's Jet

119073.name: Shining Soul II

videogameversion.150234: North American Game Boy Advance edition

119073.description:
The game features eight character classes which can be improved up to level 200. Each is customisable with a variety of weapons, spells, support abilities, and attributes. Different classes who can use the same weapons attack differently with them. For example, the Warrior's spear attack is a thrust, while the Archer throws his spear over a distance. Each usable spell in the game has its own spellbook, and only classes with that spell on their skills list can use the spellbook to cast the spell.
Warrior - A well balanced melee class. Default name: Eric (Alex in Japanese)
Archer - Attacks from afar using bows and spears, and summons forest creatures. Default name: Rwinn (Luin in Japanese)
Sorceress - Uses a variety of offensive elemental spells from a distance. Default name: Premiera (Pamela in Japanese)
Dragonute - The slowest but toughest melee class. Default name: Tyroth (Tiros in Japanese)
Priestess - Specializes in healing and support spells. Default name: Prim
Dark Wizard - Uses Dark elemental spells. Default name: Armand (Bloodstar in Japanese)
Brawler - The most powerful and quick offensive melee class, but suffers from low defense. Default name: Zachs (Sachs in Japanese)
Ninja - A swift medium-ranged class using a mix of spells and physical attacks. Default name: Raizen
??? - A Dark Wizard similar to Armand; secret character who becomes available after beating the game once. Has no default name.
Each character is able to equip up to three weapons and three items for use, and switch between them at any time. You can get 3 extra slots for either by equipping the Backpack or Knapsack. Attacks are performed by tapping the attack button, or holding to charge a more powerful attack. Beyond regular equipment, a "Soul" item can also be equipped; it is charged by defeating enemies, and unleashed to inflict massive damage on nearby enemies. They come in various elemental types and levels of effectiveness. They are graded on the roman numerals I, II, III, IV and V, with V being the strongest and taking the longest to charge up.
Characters also have resistances to a number of elements: Fire, Ice, Thunder, Light, Dark and Poison. These can be raised by equipment, but also through endurance: by taking damage of a particular elemental kind, they can increase their resistance to it, but being killed by an attack of that type will decrease the resistance level by a point.

Source: Wikipedia, "Shining Soul II", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

119074.name: Shining Force Gaiden: Final Conflict
119074.description:
Shining Force Gaiden: Final Conflict (シャイニング・フォース外伝 ～ファイナル コンフリクト～ Shainingu Fōsu Gaiden: Fainaru Konfurikuto), the third of the Gaiden sub-series, is a 1995 tactical role-playing game for the Sega Game Gear, and is both a sequel to the original Shining Force: The Legacy of Great Intention, and a prequel to Shining Force II: Ancient Sealing. It was released after both games, with the intention of connecting their plots. Despite its name, it is not directly story-related to Shining Force Gaiden (1992) or Shining Force Gaiden II (1994), also released for Game Gear.
Unlike most of its predecessors, the game was never released outside Japan. English patches have been created by fans for players who cannot speak Japanese.

119075.name: Shining Force III Scenario 2
119075.description:
Shining Force III (シャイニング・フォースIII Shainingu Fōsu III?) is a video game designed for the Sega Saturn by Camelot Software Planning. It is a continuation of the Shining series. Comprising three separate but overlapping storylines, the Japanese version of Shining Force III was released in three volumes, known as: Scenario 1 | "God Warrior of the Kingdom" Scenario 2 | "Target: Child of God", and Scenario 3 | "Bulzome Rising". For players who collected all three volumes, Camelot Soft also issued a Premium Disc featuring artwork, a character model viewer, and additional extras.
In the United States and Europe, only Scenario 1 was released. The real ending to the game can only be viewed by completing all the games in the series. This concept would later appear in Suikoden III as the "Trinity Sight System".

Source: Wikipedia, "Shining Force III", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

119076.name: Shining Force Feather
119076.description:
Shining Force Feather features a turn-based strategic battle system with an overhead perspective. Once an enemy is selected for attack, the game switches to a side perspective. This phase takes place in real time, as the player presses buttons to activate various attacks. In addition to solo attacks, the battle system will allow players to team up their forces for combination attacks.
[edit]Plot

3,000 Years ago, a war between the Shining Force warriors and enemy forces known as the Kyomu plunged the world into chaos. That war is remembered primarily in items known as artifacts, which were sealed away after the war. 3,000 years later, a young Treasure Hunter named Jin and his friend Bail discover a hidden ruin where a lost artifact is found and accidentally awaken an android girl named Alfin. A new adventure in search for lost artifacts has just begun.

Source: Wikipedia, "Shining Force Feather", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

119077.name: Air Strike!
119077.description:
Air combat in the 1980's. An extremely simple game (one tiny page of rules) in which the players command the air assets of sectors of a military front. Each has, typically, 15 to 30 planes of various types to allocate secretly to one of four missions (Scramble Ready, Ground Attack, Offensive Air Superiority, Defensive Air Superiority). The allocations are then revealed, and the players determine how many ground attacks succeeded and how many planes were shot down or damaged. Successful ground attacks score 5 victory points, downed planes 2 each.

Scenarios are provided for Germany (U.S. or U.K./Germans vs. USSR), the Mediterranean and the Middle East (Israel vs. Syria).

119078.name: Dragon Age II: Mark of the Assassin
119078.description:
Released on October 11, 2011, Mark Of The Assassin adds a new party member to the game: Tallis, an Elven Assassin voiced and modeled after actress Felicia Day, and also the lead character of the Dragon Age: Redemption webseries. In the DLC's featured quest, Hawke must help Tallis infiltrate an Orlesian estate outside Kirkwall and steal a precious relic.

Source: Wikipedia, "Dragon Age II", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

119079.name: .hack//G.U. Vol. 1: Rebirth
119079.description:
.hack//G.U. simulates a massively multiplayer online role-playing game; players assume the role of a participant in a fictional game called The World. While in The World, the player controls the on-screen player character, Haseo, from a third-person person perspective (with optional first-person mode). Within the fictional game, players explore monster-infested fields and dungeons as well as "Root Towns" that are free of combat. They also can "log-off" from the game and return to a computer desktop interface which includes in-game e-mail, news, and message boards, as well as desktop and background music customization options.

Source: Wikipedia, ".hack//G.U.", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

119080.name: .hack//G.U. Vol. 2: Reminisce
119080.description:
.hack//G.U. simulates a massively multiplayer online role-playing game; players assume the role of a participant in a fictional game called The World. While in The World, the player controls the on-screen player character, Haseo, from a third-person person perspective (with optional first-person mode). Within the fictional game, players explore monster-infested fields and dungeons as well as "Root Towns" that are free of combat. They also can "log-off" from the game and return to a computer desktop interface which includes in-game e-mail, news, and message boards, as well as desktop and background music customization options. In Reminisce, an optional card game called "Crimson VS" becomes available.

Source: Wikipedia, ".hack//G.U.", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

119081.name: .hack//G.U. Vol. 3: Redemption
119081.description:
.hack//G.U. simulates a massively multiplayer online role-playing game; players assume the role of a participant in a fictional game called The World. While in The World, the player controls the on-screen player character, Haseo, from a third-person person perspective (with optional first-person mode). The player may control the camera using the game controller's right analog stick. Within the fictional game, players explore monster-infested fields and dungeons as well as "Root Towns" that are free of combat. They also can "log-off" from the game and return to a computer desktop interface which includes in-game e-mail, news, and message boards, as well as desktop and background music customization options.

Source: Wikipedia, ".hack//G.U.", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

119082.name: Pool Paradise
119082.description:
The player controls a virtual pool player at a beach resort, who has to work his way up the tournament ladder in order to unlock features and complete the game. The game includes 30 unique computer characters, with highly-detailed hands, on an animated island with day and night cycles, and 8 virtual camera modes; 11 different game types and 5 modes of play, with 10 different tournament ladders, and 10 table sizes and shapes; and analog cueing, using a gamepad or a mouse.

Source: Wikipedia, "Pool Paradise", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

119083.name: ANTS! The Battle For The Backyard Has Begun!
119083.description:
ANTS! The Battle For The Backyard Has Begun is a card and modular board game where each player takes command of the black or red Ant Queen and battles for ultimate control of the backyard!

Every playthrough will be different with a large hexagonal play area that changes each time you play! Random events can impact gameplay by causing board pieces to shift unexpectedly or even be destroyed!

Players build armies of ants with various bonuses to go and take out the rival queen. Action cards offer the ability to ally with spiders, wasps, catterpillers, and hornets to aid in your conquest but beware; there is a large glass eye in the sky that fries your warriors without notice!

Build your subterranean base as well and attack your opponent at will in this game of skill and strategy! Each base will be different and no play-through will be the same!

119086.name: Lettres Rummikub
119086.description:
Word Rummikub, with cards instead of tiles. Players use their hand of cards to make words Rummy-style. In addition to laying new words, a player may rearrange any word to make a new word with the same letters plus at least one new letter.

Points are scored for words but if you have more than one word in front of you, only the longest counts (1 point per letter).

The winner is the one with the most points after a set number of deals.

119087.name: L'histoire de France en un tour de cartes!
119087.description:
Card game for children aged around 10 years old. There are rules to four games using the cards.

Game 1: Qui, quoi, quand?
A game for 2 players
The cards are shuffled and placed in a stack in the centre of the table. On a turn, the player takes the top card and looks at the picture and the text on the other side of the card. From this, he or she must guess the correct historical period for the card e.g. Léonard de Vinci would be a La Renaissance card. Then check the summary card. If correct, he scores a point. If not, the card is discarded and the opponent has a turn. When all the cards have been used, the one with the most points, wins.

Game 2: L'ordre chronologique
Cards are dealt out evenly. The remaing cards are placed in a stack. A card is revealed and the player must lay a card that goes immediately before the date on that card or just after it. If you cannot play a card, you must pass and take a card from the stack and add it to your hand. The first player to use all their cards, wins.

Game 3: Qui suis-je?
Stack all the cards with only the picture side showing. Each player, in turn, takes the top card and tries to name the event, person, etc. The card is then turned over to reveal the text. If the player is correct, he keeps the card. If not, it is discared. The player with the most cards when the stack is emptied, wins.

Game 4: 9 Familles
The cards are colour coded so a straightforward version of 7 Familles/Happy Families can be played. Each set collected is worth one point for every card in that set. When all the sets are played out, the winner is the one with the most points.

119088.name: Bluff
119088.description:
Card game with a lot of bluffing involved.

Rules (as written on the back of the box)

The object of the game is, by bluffing, to be the first player to dispose of all his cards.
The cards are shuffled and dealt to all the players. The player to the left of the dealer begins by placing one card face down onto the centre of the table and names its picture, for example saying "flower". The next player puts a card on top of it also saying "flower", this is when the bluffing comes in. Each player in his turn has to claim to lay the same picture as that which was started with whether he has one or not. Play continues in this way until the call comes back to the player who started the round. He calls again the name of the picture he started with and lays a card. This is the end of that round. The next player starts a new round by placing a card on top of the cards already on the table (if any) and names the same or a different picture.
Any time a player thinks another player is bluffing he may challenge him. If he is in fact bluffing and has not laid the card he said, he has to pick up all the cards on the table and add them to his hand. If he was not bluffing the challenger has to pick up all the cards.

119090.name: Lustige Autofahrt
119090.description:
Objective: be the first making the fastest lap
- moving by turn -
each player moves according 1d6 roll; ending on a marked space follow instructions printed on cover inside.
Last space must be reached with matching number - surplus movement points push you backwards.
remarks:
republished 1955 - still the same artist (board) Scheer (prename unknown)

119092.name: O for a Word
119092.description: Party game. Each guest is given a card of clues and told that the answer must end in the letter O. During the evening, they should try to answer as many correctly as they can. The player with the most correct, wins.

119093.name: EveryGame Redux
119093.description:
User Summary

EveryGame Redux lets you play a large selection of games on your iPad, iPhone, or iPod Touch.

Everygame Redux allows you to play with multiple devices via bluetooth. This will help keep player hands hidden, but if you only have one device it still isn't a problem as you can keep them off screen, and pass the single device around.

Everygame Redux allows you to save games, and even playback moves.

Unfortunately, EveryGame Redux does not have an A.I. opponent. Which means you will need to have your friends to play with.

The app comes with a lot of games, and more are to be added as time goes on.

Game list-

Eurogames:
Castle Capers
Cities of Calvino
Pirates Vs Ninjas

User Selections:
Fences (by Pokke)
Freez! (by Henry Lahore)
MuTorere (by Matt Morris)
My Apologies (by Mike Houser)
Slash-Ex-Oh (by Mike Gordon)
SpyMaster (by Steve DeWinter)

Card:
Cribbage
Euchre
Playing Cards
Word Rare

Children's Games:
7 Inch Dash

Classic:
Backgammon
Checkers
Chess
Go
Hnefatafl
Reversi
Tic Tac Toe

Utility:
Scorepad

119094.name: Sengoku Ace

videogamecompilation.146900: Psikyo Shooting Collection Vol. 2: Sengoku Ace & Sengoku Blade

119094.description:
Sengoku Ace (戦国エース), also known as Samurai Aces, is a vertically scrolling shoot 'em up arcade game released by Psikyo in 1993. It was the first game by Psikyo and was designed by Shin Nakamura, the creator of Aero Fighters (Sonic Wings) and the company's founder.

The science fantasy story of Sengoku Ace resolves around the six Feudal Japan characters sent on a mission to stop an evil cult and rescue the shogun's kidnapped daughter, princess Tsukihime (Moon Princess), before she can be used as a sacrifice to resurrect their demon god. The game features 21 endings, different for various characters and 2-player pairings.

Sengoku Ace was followed by two sequels, Sengoku Blade: Sengoku Ace Episode II in 1996 and Sengoku Cannon: Sengoku Ace Episode III in 2004.

Source: Wikipedia, "Sengoku Ace", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

119095.name: Gildenbrief (Issue 39 - Jun 1996)
119095.description: This issue contains an article about 4 new cratures also an article about elf and darkelf and one article about sleeping in roleplay.

119096.name: Gildenbrief (Issue 40 - Dec 1996)
119096.description: This issue contains new weapon skills and an adventure für Midgard 1880 "Drunter und Drüber". The issue contains also the adventure "Im Land des Sonnenadlers" for Midgard 3 as insert, the adventure was also included in Nautilus issue #08 and is still availible as pdf.

119097.name: Chienlit & Cie
119097.description:
Trivia game about history (mainly about revolutions) of France.

In his turn player spin the spinner with 2 choises: years 1968 or 2008. Question card is taken from that category. It has one minute to tell what You think and then opponents tell us are they were satisfied or not. If a majority yes, you win the points indicated on the box where it had fallen.

Winner is the player who reaches predetermined number of points.

Some example questions:
"The great struggles that everyone does not care, tell","The signs of the revolution, which were you believe."

119098.name: Ciblux
119098.description:
Each player has four small pawns and a larger pawn called Ciblux.
In his turn player roll dice and move one of his smaller pawn accordingly.

There are 3 areas in the game board to move.:
- A white area where small pieces can move "with impunity".
- A yellow box called 'danger zone' where small pieces can be ejected by the Ciblux of the opponent.
- A central area which is the goal for small pieces.

The object is to bring all his small pawns to the central area first. Alternative end is if player catches with Ciblux opponent's smaller pawn and wins.

119099.name: Gildenbrief (Issue 41 - Mar 1996)

rpgissuearticle.118495: Auf dem Weg zu Radamalona und einem Geist in Nöten

119099.description: This issue contains an alternative start for the adventure "Ein Gesit in Nöten"

119100.name: Plury One
119100.description:
Voting game where player has 2 minutes to answer a question or prove something etc. If time stops other players vote is Your answer satisfied them. If Yes You score a point.
Who reaches a predetermined score wins the game.

Some card examples: "Invent a sence that doesn't make any sence","Make us believe You are a Kangoroo", "What is priceless in You opinion"

119101.name: Gildenbrief (Issue 42 - Nov 1997)
119101.description: This issue contains the adventure "Der Steinere Gast"

119102.name: Gildenbrief (Issue 43 - Mar 1998)
119102.description: This issue contains the adventure "Düsterere Aussichten" for the Karmodin campaign. It also contains 11 new spells.

119103.name: Gildenbrief (Issue 44 - Nov 1998)
119103.description: This issue contains the adventure "Das Lied des grünen Vogels" and the author-contest winning adventure "Ilownas Odysee"

119104.name: Gildenbrief (Issue 45 - Dec 1999)
119104.description: This issue contains an article about the religion of the dwarf and an adventure "Giftmischer"

119105.name: Double Gold: Nova / Haunted House
119105.description:
User Summary:

This Double Gold compilation contains the two adventure games Nova and Haunted House from Incentive Software.

119106.name: "Summ, summ, summ, Bienchen summ herum"
119106.description:
Objective: be the first to enter space '100'
- moving by turn -
move according rolled die - ending on a marked (red) space follow instructions...
remarks:
published in GDR early 50's

119107.name: Spava
119107.description:
Spava is a game for the Shibumi set, made as an entry for Shibumi Challenge.

Two players, White and Black, take turns adding either a ball of their colour or a neutral red ball.

A player wins by completing a line of length L of their colour on any LxL level. A player loses by completing a line of length L-1 on any LxL level. Lines can be orthogonal or diagonal but must contain at least two balls.

Included in the Shibumi Rule Book

Soft cover:

http://www.lulu.com/shop/cameron-browne-and-nestor-romeral-a...

Downloadable PDF:

http://www.nestorgames.com/rulebooks/SHIBUMI_EN.pdf

119108.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Humans!!! 3: ZombieCon moves the brain-munching action to the happiest place on earth. That's right – your zombies have decided to look for lunch at the local gaming convention. Will you eat the CCG player? Maybe the RPG fan would be easier to catch. If all else fails, security looks tasty! So many choices!

Humans!!! 3: ZombieCon lets players explore a large gaming convention looking for more brains to eat or candidates to convert. This expansion also adds a new card type called "Personalities" that determine WHO you encounter and how much "fight" they have in them.
119108.name: Humans!!! 3: ZombieCon

119109.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Beneath the mountain called Goblins' Rock, the goblins have been mining for centuries. They have dug deeper and deeper. Their precious ore is running out and the taskmasters are getting BORED!

So in order to pass the time, the taskmasters have taken to racing their underlings into a...PIT OF FIRE! (Underlings are expendable, after all.) It is agreed that secretly choosing their favorites would be best and the race would end when the "winner" falls into the pit. Oh, and there should be gambling. You know, just to keep it interesting!

Go Goblin, Go! is a light, standalone racing and gambling board game. You secretly pick three of the racing goblins and you get points based on where they finish. You manipulate their movement, so you have some control over where they finish. Just don't be first. The first goblin to fall into the pit "wins", but they don't get any points.
119109.name: Go Goblin, Go!

119110.name: Sundered Space (Alpha Playtest)
119110.description:
From Publisher's Website:
Troopers from five warring factions stranded on the barren world of Tundari, cut off from your mother ships - will you survive? Can you regroup? Will you forge a truce with troopers from the other factions who are trapped on this planet with you? And what of the ancient secrets of the Xen race which once inhabited Tundari? Don your all-environments carapace and your hover pack, adjust your energy shield settings, pick up your plasma blast rifle, stride forth, explore and do battle!

Sundered Space is in its alpha playtest edition (version 1.1) following its debut at Indiecon 2008. Plans to release version 1.2 have been shelved due to ongoing work on a new fantasy game, Omnifray Lite. It is likely that any future version of Sundered Space will use an adapted version of the Omnifray Lite system as its foundation.

119111.description:
Each player roll the dice and move around the board to bring together the different ingredients of the pancake batter.
Once "milk shed", "flour weighing" and "broken eggs" are collected it's time the frying pan in hand to be the cleverest to blow up pancakes in a limited time.
But beware! There can be surprise on some squares on the board.

Winner is the player to make 15 pancakes.first.

Contents:

game board,
4 colored pawns,
1 die,
1 hourglass
12 cards ingredients
double-sided skillet,
a pancake,
crepe 60 tokens.
119111.name: Crêpes Party

119112.name: Envoyer (Issue 111 - Jan 2006)

rpg.1350: It Came from the Late, Late, Late Show (1st, 2nd & 3rd edition)

119112.description: This issue contains the Midgard adventure "Die Schatzkammer der Sonnenkrone" and 2 short love adventure.

119113.name: Envoyer (Issue 112 - Feb 2006)
119113.description: This issue contains an adventure for Private Eye "Ein seltsamer Selbstmord" and one adventure for LodlanD "Wenn Engel sterben" and one adventure for Shadowrun "Run für eine Leiche"

119114.name: Marx O Matic Basketball
119114.description:
1950's Marx O Matic children's basketball game - Tin litho.

Metal Base of the game is 22" long X 13" wide and the metal back is 11" Tall.

Game comes with an automatic scoreboard. Players use the shooter, attached to base, to lob balls into the net.

The shooter base has a counter that keeps track of 12 shots and then rings the bell when complete.

119115.name: Envoyer (Issue 114 - Apr 2006)
119115.description: This issue contains the first part of the Cthulhu adventure "Familienfluch" and two short adventures also for Cthulhu "Der Rattenkönig" and "Cthuhlu West"

119116.name: Dawn of the Scarlet Sun
119116.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The coastal city of Magnimar is no stranger to crime, yet recently, a series of murders has sent a chill through the early morning streets. Someone—or something—is stalking and killing worshipers of Sarenrae, the goddess of the sun. The city guard is prepared to ambush the murderer, but they need help—help of the kind that adventurers are so good at providing. What is the sinister truth behind these violent acts?

Dawn of the Scarlet Sun is a Pathfinder RPG adventure for six 5th-level characters—such as the six iconic heroes provided. In addition, this adventure can be integrated into the Shattered Star Pathfinder Adventure Path, and uses the villains featured in the Pathfinder Battles Champions of Evil Encounter Pack.

This special 16-page Pathfinder Module will initially be made available for Free RPG Day on June 16, 2012. Print editions will be available exclusively on the Paizo website beginning June 18, 2012. A FREE PDF will also be available on that date.

From the back of the book

A murderer stalks the streets of Magnimar! The guards are baffled, people huddle in their homes, and whispers spread of the death delivered on dark wings. Desperate for aid, the city watch turns to bold adventurers, revealing more of the murders' gruesome details and bringing the heroes in on a daring plan to catch the killer - a plot that makes them a tempting target for the maniac's bloody knife. This dangerous ploy sets the heroes on a path fraught with savage creatures, decades-old secrets, and the dark desires of an immortal evil that seeks to pervert a forgotten house of worship. Will they be able to put an end to the slaughter? Or will all of Magnimar drown in the rising tide of blood?

Dawn of the Scarlet Sun is an adventure for 5th-level characters, written for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game and compatible with the 35 edition of the world's oldest RPG.

119117.name: Envoyer (Issue 115 - May 2006)
119117.description: This issue contains the second part of the Cthulhu adventure "Familienfluch" and one short adventure for L5R, Oriental Adventures or Bushido "Der letzte Aramasu" and one short adventure for shadowrun "Musashis Schwert" and one bigger advneture for shadowrun "Westworld"

119118.name: Envoyer (Issue 116 - Jun 2006)
119118.description: This issue contains one big DSA adventure "XIII", one small adventure "Feier mit Hindernissen" and two short adventures "Heiliger Strohsack" & "Seelenverwandschaft"

119119.name: Mutant Mudds

videogamehonor.34405: 2012 Operation Rainfall Awards Best Download Only Game of the Year Nominee

119119.description:
User Summary

A meteor has hit Earth and the Mutant Mudd aliens are trying to take over the world. A blonde-haired nerd picks up his water pistol and water powered jet-pack and leaves his Granny's house to send these aliens back to where they came from.

Mutant Mudds is a 2D/3D hybrid platform game. Using the 3D technology of the Nintendo 3DS, your hero can jump into the background and foreground of the screen. This game pays homage to the good ol' retro days with its old school graphics and music.

119120.name: Wormholes
119120.description:
"Wormholes, finally on Iphone and Ipod Touch! Finish the game by completing numerous 3D puzzles based in underground chambers. Only with the A978 Wormhole Gun will you have the ability to create wormholes allowing you to complete the level. In addition, you must use the cubes and buttons around the various parts of the level to open doors allowing you to arrive at the finish. Have fun with the portals!

-Play through numerous exciting levels

-Use the A978 Wormhole Gun to travel around the level instantaneously

-Use cubes and buttons to unlock doors to get to the finish!"

Source: The Game Website.

119121.name: Envoyer (Issue 117 - Jul 2006)
119121.description: This issue contains a short adventure for Unknown Armies "Der Schlüsselanhänger" and two dirty short adventures for Cyberpunk "Drei Vampire für Pater Johnson" & Menschenfleisch"

119122.name: Envoyer (Issue 118 - Aug 2006)
119122.description: This issue contains the Unknown Armies adventure "Adel Verpflichtet"

119123.name: Envoyer (Issue 119 - Sep 2006)
119123.description: This issue contains two adventures for LodlanD "Die Gerechtigkeit der Haue" & "20.000 Meilen unter dem Meer"

119124.name: Envoyer (Issue 121 - Nov 2006)
119124.description: This issue contains an adventure for Cthulhu "Der Mann aus Eisen", one adventure for Castle Falkenstein "Ein kaltblütiger Raub" and the second part of the DSA adventure "Nächtlicher Schrecken"

119125.name: Envoyer (Issue 122 - Dec 2006)
119125.description: This issue contains a fantasy universal adventure "Das Seufzende Moor" and an adventur for LodlanD "Morgen früh, wenn Gott will..."

119126.name: Dragonology
119126.description:
User Summary

Travel the world on the back of dragons, keep a journal, and venture forth to defeat the nefarious Silus Copperbone. Care for and battle over 40 different dragons.

119127.name: Envoyer (Issue 123 - Jan 2007)
119127.description: This issue contains an adventure for Shadowrun "Bring mich um, Baby!" and one fantasy universal adventure "Der Oger von Mühlenfurt" and an adventure for Cthulhu "Eine Nacht auf dem Land"

119128.name: Pool Shark 2
119128.description:
Pool Shark 2 is a video game which was developed by Blade Interactive as a sequel to Pool Shark (a.k.a. Actua Pool and Underground Pool). Pool Shark 2 (styled "Pool:shark2" in its box cover logo) features several different pool (pocket billiards) games including standard eight-ball and nine-ball through to ten-pin pool.

Source: Wikipedia, "Pool Shark 2", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

119129.name: Wizardology
119129.description:
UNRELEASED GAME - CANCELLED




This game was cancelled in development. Please only submit images if you own a copy or have legal access to this item.




User Summary

Create spells, travel, and interact with other wizards. Protect and care for a variety of creatures.

119130.name: Envoyer (Issue 124 - Feb 2007)
119130.description: This issue contains the adventure "Der Schrei der Bestie" for Cthulhu and an adventure idea for Shadowrun "Sally"

119131.name: Fuzzy Heroes (Second Edition)
119131.description:
from the introduction

Fuzzy Heroes uses stuffed animals and toys of all kinds as the characters and combatants in miniature and role-playing battles. These toys gain the energy to move and pursue their noble goals from the land of FrolicHaven, a mystic land which only toys can access through secret doorways that exist in the back of every closet (which is why kids are always hearing noises in the back of the closet).

Fuzzy Heroes is designed to be played by two or more people using actual toys, whether as a role-playing or a miniatures game, and so you’re going to need some space. The living room floor, the dining room table, or the top of a bed make ample playing surfaces; all are suitably large for good Fuzzy Heroes gaming. Each player should have and will need at least one toy, but what toys are used is unimportant, other than to the person that will have to play the part of that toy in the upcoming game.

119132.name: Envoyer (Issue 125 - Mar 2007)
119132.description:
This issue included a complete "Quick Start" for Cthulhu with core rules, sheets and a short adventure. (It can be seperateted from the issue (32 pages with own index). Cthulhu für Einsteiger (The version with "Nachts im Schwarzwald")

It also contains an adventure for Unknown Armies "Flaschenpost"

119133.name: Envoyer (Issue 126 - Apr 2007)
119133.description: This issue contains the Heredium Light rules, which can be seperated from the issue. And it contains teh Midgard adventure "Mord auf hoher See"

119134.name: Envoyer (Issue 127 - May 2007)
119134.description:
This issue contains the Light rules for Funky Colts, which can be seperated from the issue.
It also contains an adventure for Heredium "Verbrechen und Strafe"

119135.name: Envoyer (Issue 128 - Jun 2007)
119135.description:
