This issue contains the light rules for Monster aus der Spätvorstellung, which can be seperated from the issue.
It also contains a solo-adventure "Das vergessene Tal"

119136.name: Envoyer (Issue 129 - Jul/Aug 2007)
119136.description: This issue contains the adventure "Überfall" for Mondagor

119137.name: Envoyer (Issue 130 - Sep 2007)
119137.description: This issue contains an adventure for Cthulhu "Böses Blut" and an universal horror adventure "Die Nacht der lebenden Toten"

119138.name: Envoyer (Issue 131 - Oct 2007)
119138.description: This issue contains the Discworld adventure "Das Sterben des Brian" and the Fireborn adventure "Die Macht der Schwachen"

119139.name: Envoyer (Issue 132 - Nov 2007)
119139.description: This issue contains the light rules for Ratten! It also contains an adventure for Orbis Incognita "Hinter den Masken"

119140.name: Envoyer (Issue 133 - Dec 2007)
119140.description: This issue contains an adventure for Ratten! "Das Abendteuer" and an adventure for D&D 3.5 "Mord ohne Leiche"

119141.name: Envoyer (Issue 134 - Jan 2008)
119141.description: This issue contains an adventure for Der Hexer von Salem "Krankenhaus der Zombies" and one universal short adventure "Heilige Blumen"

119142.name: Contre Jour

videogamehonor.31916: 2011 Game Critics Best Handheld Game of the Year Nominee

119142.description:
Blurring the lines between games and interactive art, Contre Jour welcomes you to a hauntingly beautiful world shaped by the interplay of light and darkness.

Use your finger to morph the landscape, propelling the mysterious creature Petit to safety. Pull, swipe, and tap gadgets such as tendrils, air geysers, and pulleys to complete clever puzzles. Set to a poignant orchestrated soundtrack from composer David Ari Leon, Contre Jour both delights and bedevils from start to finish.

Source: The Game Website.

119143.name: Home Sheep Home
119143.description:
Home Sheep Home was created to be released on the launch of newly designed Shaun the Sheep website.

Predominantly a puzzle solving game, the aim is to get Shaun, Shirley and Timmy back to the safety of the barn, whilst avoiding the obstacles. There are often a number of different ways of completing each of the 15 levels, which has prompted numerous walk-through guides across the internet.

Within a month of launching Home Sheep Home on the Shaun the Sheep website and seeding it to various gaming portals, the game racked up over 6.5 million plays, with an impressive personal-best of 900,000 plays in one day. It was also featured as a favourite game on the homepages of top gaming portals, Newgrounds and Kongregate, and has now been hosted by over 3,600 other sites.

Home Sheep Home has now had over 80 million plays.

Source: The Game Website.

119144.name: Mental Powers
119144.description:
Publisher's Blurb:

Think all super-powers are physical? Think again... Mental Powers delves into the extraordinary abilities of the mind, from mind-reading and clairvoyance to astral projection and various mental tricks and attacks. Learn how to apply the "mind" descriptor and create powers focused on it and handle everything from possession to mind-switching. The power really is "all in your mind"! This product is for Mutants & Masterminds Third Edition.

119145.name: Home Sheep Home 2
119145.description:
Test your logic skills in this sequel to the BAFTA-nominated hit, Shaun the Sheep, from the house that brought you Wallace & Gromit, Chicken Run, and Flushed Away. Get the lovable sheep — Shaun, Timmy, and Shirley — to the goal by figuring out the right combination of moves based on each one’s abilities. Simple, gorgeous, and impossibly gratifying.

Source: The Game Website.

119146.name: Ravenmark: Scourge of Estellion

videogamehonor.21142: 2011 Charles S. Roberts Best Science-Fiction or Fantasy Computer Wargame Nominee

119146.description:
Ravenmark: Scourge of Estellion is a turn-based RPG that bases it's roots upon a pedigree of well-loved SRPG's like fire Emblem, Final Fantasy Tactics, and Advance Wars. An intricate overarching storyline, spread over four major chapter Arcs, weaves together the fate of six nations in this land known as Eclisse, their collective destinies intertwined through the marks of history and ambition.

Source: The Developer Website.

119147.name: Terra Noctis
119147.description:
Allen is attending the local Nightmare School, but hasn't quite got what it takes to be scary enough – at least, not yet. Following the failing of his recent test, he becomes motivated by a local legend printed in a book: “Eat the heart of the scariest nightmare and become a scary nightmare, too.” With that, his journey begins to become the scariest nightmare in the land.

-Perfectly responsive controls
-Smooth animations
-High quality pixel art graphics
-Hours of gameplay
-Own soundtrack, especially enjoyable with headphones
-Fight against gigantic, challenging end bosses
-Find friends who accompany you on your journey
-Take advantage of the opportunity to equip active and passive power-ups
-Collect objects that allow you to unlock extra levels
-OpenFeint Support

Source: The Developer Website.

119148.name: Jazz: Trump's Journey
119148.description:
JAZZ: Trump's Story is an ambitious parallel with Louis Armstrong's life. Immerse yourself in Trump's memories to learn how he became a famous Jazzman.
Let your inspiration guide you in this absorbing platform game.

-Travel in New Orleans in 1920's with stylized graphics
Follow the story of the young Trump and participate in the birth of Jazz music
-Discover the soundtrack, especially composed by jazz musicians
Use your trump to stop time
-Fight all dangers: boss, moving platforms, policemen, pics...
-Game Center/Facebook/Twitter
-Universal version iPhone/iPad

Source: The Developer Website.

119149.name: Caylus
119149.description:
Caylus is a strategy oriented, German-style board game designed by William Attia and independently published in 2005 by Ystari in France and England, and Rio Grande Games in North America. Caylus has a mix of building, producing, planning, and bargaining — without direct conflict or dice-rolling mechanics.

An iOS version of Caylus that can be played on the iPhone and iPad was launched on January 16, 2012.

Source: Wikipedia, "Caylus", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

119150.name: Titan HD
119150.description:
Titan is a full-out monster slug-a-thon, in which players must be prepared to sacrifice their creatures to cause maximum damage to their opponents. Players take the role of the Titan, and roam the board attempting to recruit bigger and badder monsters to fight for their legions. But just as your own army grows, your opponents themselves will be seeking the clash of battle, and there can be only one true Titan!

Titan is played on a main gameboard, where armies are recruited, and positions set. When two armies meet, the action transfers to a battleboard, where the opposing forces battle for position and power. Only the strongest monsters will survive, bringing both points and glory to their Titan.

Source: The Developer Website.

119151.name: Mage Gauntlet
119151.description:
Mage Gauntlet is a classic-SNES-style Action-RPG from Rocketcat Games

42 levels of sword swinging, spell slinging adventure!
Mix and match loot to support your playstyle!
Beat the game to unlock Master Mode's 42 extra levels!

Source: The Game Website.

119153.name: Nickelodeon Dance
119153.description:
Dance along with Dora, Diego, the Backyardigans and The Fresh Beat Band.

Gamers big and small will twist, shimmy and shake to 30 songs sung by Nickelodeon friends including theme songs and Nickelodeon hits like "We Did It," "Al Rescate," and "Here We Go." Popular favorites like "Dancing in the Street," "We Got the Beat," and "Rhythm is Gonna Get You!" ensure fun for the entire family!

Features


1st dance videogame featuring your favorite Nickelodeon friends!
Developed with an Emmy- recognized kids’ choreographer!
Includes a work-out feature for heart healthy activity!
30 songs sung by your favorite Nickelodeon characters!


Source: The Publisher Website.

119154.name: Nickelodeon Fit
119154.description:
Nickelodeon Fit is a fitness game designed for Preschoolers and younger kids and the first fitness game designed specifically for children featuring characters from the famous Nick Jr. shows. It also features voice actors from the popular Nickelodeon television shows. The game features 30 exercise games targeting cardiovascular activity, core muscles, upper and lower body strength, balance, motor skill development and foot and hand-eye coordination. It also incorporates a tracking feature so parents can monitor the progress of their children in metrics.

Nickelodeon Fit was developed in collaboration with physical education and exercise science expert Dr. Jackie Goodway. 2K Play first shown the game at the Electronic Entertainment Expo 2010 (E3 2010), along with other shooters, third-person action and sports games they published

Gameplay

The game features 30 exercise games targeting cardiovascular activity, bigger legs, core muscles, upper and lower body strength, balance, motor skill development and foot and hand-eye coordination. Each of them require jumping rope with the Backyardigans, go river rafting with Diego, leap over hurdles with Kai-lan or pogo stick with Dora. Players can also participate in a stamina-building relay race featuring all of the game's characters.

Nickelodeon Fit incorporates a tracking feature so parents can monitor the progress of their children in metrics, including total exercise time and different intensities of physical activity on a daily, weekly and monthly basis. In addition, they can customize workout routines to focus on designated areas of improvement. For example, cross-country biking with Dora can be selected to address endurance and dirt boarding with Diego can be selected to help improve balance and dexterity.

Source: Wikipedia, "Nickelodeon Fit", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

119156.name: Nicktoons MLB
119156.description:
A dugout full of Nicktoons including Spongebob Squarepants, ZIM, Dudley Puppy, Fanboy, Chum Chum, Stimpy and more "go yard" with superstars from all 30 MLB teams in Nicktoons MLB. Out-of-this world ballparks, color commentary by Perch Perkins and exciting baseball action bring this epic showdown home!

Source: The Publisher Website.

119157.name: L.A. Rush

videogamehonor.30969: 2005 Spike Best Driving Game of the Year Nominee

119157.description:
L.A. Rush is the 4th installment in the Rush series of video games. The PlayStation Portable version was released on October 30, 2006 and named Rush.

The game is free-roaming with races similar to those in Need for Speed: Underground 2. The GPS map can have a point assigned to a certain location and then the point shows up on the radar during gameplay. The game features voice talent from Orlando Jones, Bill Bellamy, and Twista. In addition to the console versions and PC version it was to be available on Gizmondo.

District Areas:
Hollywood
Hollywood
Beverly Hills
Mulholland Drive

Downtown
Downtown Los Angeles
Little Tokyo
Fashion District
Financial District

South Central
Compton
Carson
Los Angeles International Airport

South Bay
Long Beach
San Pedro (Port of L.A.)

Santa Monica
Santa Monica
Marina Del Rey
Venice Beach

Source: Wikipedia, "L.A. Rush", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

119158.name: LarryBoy and the Bad Apple

videogameversion.150407: North American Game Boy Advance edition

119158.description:
LarryBoy and the Bad Apple is the 29th episode in the VeggieTales animated series, and the third installment of the LarryBoy adventures. It was released in 2006 and is only available on DVD format.

LarryBoy and the Bad Apple was released as a video game on the PS2 and Game Boy Advance platforms, (ever since the LarryBoy and the Bad Apple movie is the first to be only released and available on DVD and never on VHS).

Source: Wikipedia, "LarryBoy and the Bad Apple", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

From Game Box:

Discover 5 zany worlds and a multitude of missions as LarryBoy helps save the citizens of Bumblyburg from temptation and the Bad Apple
Song Bonus Missions provide additional entertainment and play time
Child appropriate fun with 3 difficulty levels to choose from
Combines classic platforming with adventure and puzzle solving for hours of fun and re-playability
Trusty Alfred supplies LarryBoy with amazing superhero Gadgets to earn and use to fight temptation and save the citizens

119159.name: Leaderboard Golf
119159.description:
Leaderboard, the first golf game in the series Leaderboard Golf, was released in 1986 and included four different water-based courses. It was well received, being rated as 97% overall by Zzap 64 magazine and being prized with their "Gold Award". It was also highly rated by other magazines, with Your Sinclair rating it 9 out of 10.

Source: Wikipedia, "Leaderboard Golf", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

119160.name: Leaderboard Tournament
119160.description:
User Summary

Leaderboard Tournament is the follow-up game to Leaderboard Golf which had been released earlier the same year. It is a series of expansion disks each containing four new courses.

119161.name: Leaderboard Executive
119161.description:
This is the second full game in the series Leaderboard (or Leaderboard Golf) which was released in 1987 and contained new landscape and course features, such as trees and bunkers. Despite these additions, the game was less well received than its predecessor, being given an overall rating of 72% by Zzap 64 magazine.

Source: Wikipedia, "Leaderboard Golf", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

119162.name: World Class Leaderboard
119162.description:
World Class Leaderboard was the last game in the Leaderboard series and included four courses; Cypress Creek, Doral Country Club, St Andrews, and the fictional Gauntlet Country Club. Three course expansion disks were later released.

Special features included in this final version are a course overview (overhead view), the punch shot, a printable score card, and a course editor which allowed changes to be made to the existing courses.

Source: Wikipedia, "Leaderboard Golf", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

119163.name: The Legend of Alon D'ar
119163.description:
The game plays somewhat like the Final Fantasy series' Active Time Battle, with the player having to wait certain time for their turn. What makes this system different from ATB is that the time that has to pass changes with the weapon the player is wielding, for example an axe will need more time than a dagger to attack.

The game features a vast world to explore; with several towns and monsters to combat with. The game also features multiplayer experience after advancing in the story.

There are several types of spells like Water, Earth, Sound etc. that are stored in Orbs. This Orbs can be leveled up to unlock more spells or make the unlocked ones more powerful. As with weapons, certain Orbs take much longer to cast the spell than others.

Source: Wikipedia, "Legend of Alon D'ar", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

119164.name: The Prize
119164.description:
From the cassette inlay:

You are in charge of a space ship fully armed with laser pulse torpedoes. Your mission to discover the mystery of the maze. Many people have tried, many people have failed. Some perish on the first level, their debris scattered throughout all eternity, whilst others fail on the very threshold of the chamber of Midas where the secret is held. Guardians are strewn through the maze...

User Summary:

The company behind the game put up a £5,000 prize for anyone that could complete the game and uncover its secret. Unfortunately for us VGGers though, the competition closed "12 noon, 29th January 1985."

119165.description:
Serpent Stones is an interpretation of an ancient game believed to have been played by the Aztecs over 600 years ago. As head priest of an Aztec warrior house, you must command a specialized team of Aztec warriors in ritual combat on the battlefield to satisfy the gods. Drawing on the power of teotl from your temple stone, your warriors can wield specialized nahualli animal attacks to strike or capture opposing warriors standing in your team's way of capturing your opponent's temple stone. The gods may show you favor by giving you an advantage during battle, but will it be you or your opponent that quenches their insatiable blood thirst today?

Players of Serpent Stones sit on opposite sides of a game board featuring seven staggered rows of Serpent Stones and take turns drawing a card and playing/discarding a card from an initial hand of five cards. Serpent Stones features three types of cards:


Warrior cards, which are played on the Serpent Stones to build your Aztec warrior team
Nahualli cards, which strike or capture opposing warrior cards
Teotl cards, which are "god" cards that can give a player some tactical advantage during gameplay


A player wins when either he captures his opponent's temple stone by placing a warrior card on it or he forces his opponent to suffer the "Wrath of Tezcatlipoca", a fancy Aztecian way of saying the opponent ran out of cards.
119165.name: Serpent Stones

119166.name: Time-Gate
119166.description:
User Summary

The Earth has been invaded by an alien race named "the Squarm". The player, an elite member of the Temporal Brotherhood and in possession of the interstellar spaceship Void-Runner 1, travels from sector to sector in space in search of Time-Gates which will transport the player back in time. The goal: Finding the enemy headquarters in the distant past and destroying it.

The gameplay for each particular period of time places the player in a 6x3 gridded sector of space. The player can warp between the different areas (which are shown to contain enemy ships and/or planets) in search of the elusive Time-Gate which could be in any area. Fighting with Squarm enemy ships takes place in a 3D view out the cockpit window, and any sustained damage can be repaired by landing on the various planets, although you may of course have to battle aliens to be able to get there.

119168.name: Little Britain: The Video Game
119168.description:
Little Britain: The Video Game is a collection of mini-games presented in the format of an episode from the TV show and players can get interactive with the sketch show characters in a series of eight mini-games featuring Lou and Andy, Vicky Pollard, Mr. Mann, Emily and Florence, Marjorie Dawes, Daffyd Thomas, Judy & Maggie and Letty. Each mini game plays like a sketch from the TV show and to win the game, the player must progress through all the sketches to the end of the show, where the credits will roll.

Source: Wikipedia, "Little Britain: The Video Game", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

119169.name: LMA Manager 2001
119169.description:
LMA Manager 2001, the second LMA game released - and also on PlayStation - in March 2001.

Two versions were released, one for the English leagues as before, and another specifically covering the Scottish Premier and Football Leagues. The in-match action is presented by former footballer turned BBC analyst Alan Hansen. Sometimes this version gets caught in between the retro style of the original game, and the 2002 version. Although practically the same as the 2002 version, this contains some differences in the in-match play, and is famed for wingers cutting inside to shoot from ridiculous angles, and goalkeepers who tend to tip shots just inside the far post, making this an often frustrating game. There are also a few mistakes on the game, such as Birmingham City's Bryan Hughes being 29, instead of his proper age at the time, which was 24. It is also occasional for defenders to pick up the ball in their own penalty box, and proceed to kick it out like a keeper, as well as people scoring from their kick-off. A slight difference from the original is the length of gameplay - this version finishing after 30 seasons in football management while the previous version finished after 50 seasons.

Source: Wikipedia, "LMA Manager 2002", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

119170.name: LMA Manager 2002
119170.description:
LMA 2002 was the final version in the series to be released on PlayStation, launched in October 2001. Although chiefly just an update from the 2001 version, the game did prove to be quite a stepping stone from the LMA of old and the LMA seen today. The transition to PlayStation 2 was a remarkable one.

The first PlayStation 2 incarnation went under the same name when released in April 2002. A significant update from PS1, it allowed players to manage in one of six European leagues, all of which were processed by the game simultaneously (the top two divisions in Italy, Spain, Germany and France were added, in addition to the existing top four divisions in England and Scotland). On the PS2, matches played out in full in a 3D match environment, followed by post-match highlights voiced by famous BBC presenter Gary Lineker alongside the returning Hansen. The game play advanced in this game from the 2001 version, in particular the in-match style. Players tend to shoot early, from around thirty yards, rather than enter into the penalty area.

Source: Wikipedia, "LMA Manager 2002", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

119171.name: LMA Manager 2003
119171.description:
Released in November 2002, this was the first edition to be released on Xbox, alongside the PS2 release. The version added no additional leagues and contained minor enhancements from the previous game. However it is widely considered the greatest LMA Manager game of the series with many votes on the Codemasters forum in approval.

Source: Wikipedia, "LMA Manager 2002", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

119172.name: LMA Manager 2004
119172.description:
The next in the series was released in March 2004 on PS2 and Xbox, and added a variety of enhancements to the match, as well as new commentary in the post-match highlights voiced by renowned commentator Barry Davies and analysed by Lineker and Hansen as before. New 'Fantasy Team' mode (replacing the 'Challenge Mode' in earlier games) whereby users could build up a team from scratch using a preallocated budget, based loosely on the popular fantasy football game. Once the user had compiled a squad and selected a team name, stadium and kit, the newly-created club would compete in one of the leagues in the game. Another new feature in this version was the option (on Xbox only) of issuing tactical instructions to your team via the Xbox Communicator headset during a match.

The game had its downsides also. If a player in your team improved over a season, his wage would reflect his improvement in the following season, even if there is no contract renewal. When managing a smaller club these non-negotiated wage rises of a squad the size of twenty for example, can put your budgets in the red and result in having to offload your best players, which can be very frustrating.

Source: Wikipedia, "LMA Manager series", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

119173.name: LMA Manager 2005
119173.description:
LMA 2005 was released on PS2 and Xbox in October 2004, and chief amongst the enhancements was the addition of the Dutch and Portuguese leagues and English Football Conference division, the first new playable leagues to be added since 2002. Another unique feature was the option to download a mid-season player roster update via Xbox Live or the PlayStation online service. PS2 owners with access to an EyeToy camera could take a photo of themselves, which would appear on various newspaper articles seen in the game (for example, a celebration photo after winning a trophy, or an unhappy image after being sacked by their club).

Source: Wikipedia, "LMA Manager series", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

119175.name: LMA Professional Manager 2005
119175.description:
Released alongside LMA 2005 and Manchester United Manager, this version was notable for two reasons - it was the first game in the series to be released on PC, and the first developed externally (by Kuju rather than Codemasters). The change of platform required a redesigned interface, with the straightforward joypad-based navigation of PS2 replaced by a mouse-driven control system more similar to a graphical user interface such as Microsoft Windows. Each screen the user progressed to was housed on a separate window, which made finding one's way from section to section rather awkward.

Content-wise, the PC version contained the same playable leagues, 3D match engine and transfer system as the console version, although there were extra non-playable countries added from around the world to bolster the transfer market.

Source: Wikipedia, "LMA Manager series", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

119176.name: LMA Manager 2006
119176.description:
In November 2005, LMA 2006 was released on PS2 and Xbox, with a further three playable divisions included from Dutch and Portuguese leagues, as well as further enhancements to the 3D match, transfer market and player training setup (including playable 3D Training Matches for the first time). In keeping with the series' visual roots, a new option allowed players to create a 3D model of their manager, who could be seen pacing along the touchlines during a match or featuring in one of the new video headlines (introducing a new transfer signing to the press, for example) included in the game world's TV station.

This game provided the most complex transfer processes yet, with the ability to swap players and give instalments. However, the game limits you to only having four transfers made via contract clauses (i.e. 10% sell on clause or £75,000 to be transferred after fifteen appearances). Using contract clauses, you can usually pick the player up for a cheaper transfer fee than what you would if you didn't use a contract clause, but after you've used all four and try to use another, it will say that the club who the player currently plays for cannot afford to let him go. Once you sell anyone you have used with a contract clause, you may then buy a player using another contract clause.

After the third-party conversion of LMA Professional Manager 2005, a second PC version was being developed by Codemasters themselves and was scheduled for release in Spring 2006 alongside the first seventh-generation iteration on Xbox 360. However, these versions' development slipped back, making LMA Manager 2007 a tri-format release.

Source: Wikipedia, "LMA Manager series", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

119177.name: LMA Manager 2007
119177.description:
This was released on 22 September 2006 on PS2, PC-DVD, and Xbox 360 , with transfer updates available for download on the PC version. Like other versions of the PC, it uses a graphical user interface like LMA 2005. The lack of subsequent titles, and the fact that the PC version of LMA 2007 will not run on operating systems past Windows Vista due to its use of a StarForce DRM, and its limited availability on 7th generation games consoles, meant as of 2009 the LMA series became effectively defunct.

Source: Wikipedia, "LMA Manager series", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

119178.name: Lupin the 3rd: Treasure of the Sorcerer King
119178.description:
Lupin the 3rd: Treasure of the Sorcerer King (ルパン三世 魔術王の遺産 Rupan Sansei Majutsu-Ou no Isan, Lupin the Third: The Legacy of the Magic King) is an stealth/action video game from Bandai. It has an original story based on the anime series Lupin III.
The gameplay relies heavily on stealth and the use of various disguises and is displayed from a third person perspective.

Lupin is out to steal a pair of antique pitchers which will supposedly show the way to the legendary treasure of King Randolph II. The mysterious Theodore Hannewald is planning to display them at an exhibition at his ancestral castle in Goldengasse (a European city heavily inspired by Prague), but might have something more in mind. In any case, he doesn't want them stolen and has put Inspector Zenigata in charge of security. Also, young Theresa Faust, the owner of the pitchers, seems to be troubled by something - and it's not like Lupin to desert a fair maiden in distress!

Source: Wikipedia, "Lupin the 3rd: Treasure of the Sorcerer King", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

119179.name: Little Fighter
119179.description:
Little Fighter (simplified Chinese: 小朋友齐打交; traditional Chinese: 小朋友齊打交; pinyin: Xiǎo Péng Yǒu Jì Dǎ Jiāo) is a multiplayer beat 'em up game designed and developed by Marti Wong and released in 1997. In this game, the player can choose to be one of 11 characters. Each character has 3 special moves and then the player participate in an all out fight. The game allows for one on one matches, team matches or elimination tournament matches. There is up to 8 fighters simultaneously on screen controlled by up to 3 human players. The most recent version has online playing capabilities.

Source: Wikipedia, "Little Fighter", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

119180.name: Little Fighter 2
119180.description:
Little Fighter 2 (LF2) is a popular freeware PC fighting game for Windows and is the sequel to Little Fighter 1 (LF1). LF2 was created by Marti Wong and Starsky Wong in 1999, and released in a long series of updates.

Source: The Game Website.

119181.name: Little Fighter Online
119181.description:
Little Fighter Online (LFO, Chinese: 小朋友齊打交 Online) is a fighting game for Windows which is popular at start in Hong Kong, but has shown a rapid decline in popularity in its progress. The gameplay itself is based on the earlier Little Fighter 2 game, which had many of the same features at first glance. The game was produced by Marti Wong (involved in all LF games) and Oscar Chu, a Chinese MMO developer.

Source: Wikipedia, "Little Fighter Online", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

119182.name: Oil Rush
119182.description:
In a post-apocalyptic flooded world there are two things running short: oil and time. The last survivors in a desperate desire to seize control and dominate the enemy have started the naval warfare that turned the whole world into one large battlefield. In these harsh and cruel times, oil is thicker than blood.

Oil Rush is a real-time strategy game based on group control. It offers mechanics of a classical RTS combined with a Tower Defence genre: control the upgrade of production platforms as well as their defence forces, and send battle groups of naval and air units to capture enemy platforms and oil rigs.

Source: The Developer Website.

119183.name: Spring Heel Jack
119183.description:
Action board game. The board has 16 holes in it. The player loads a spring device and places it on the table, as far back as he wishes, and catapults a ball onto the board. If it settles into one of the holes, a score of 2 to 10 points will be scored. The one with the most points when the game ends, wins.

The spring device will cause the player to experiment. Two factors are involved - how far back to reach the board and how much to hold the device down before releasing it. It must be easy to over-shoot or under-shoot the board.

119184.name: Ice Age

videogameversion.150460: North American Game Boy Advance edition

119184.description:
A video game tie-in was published by Ubisoft for the Game Boy Advance, and received poor reviews.
Ice Age is a 2002 American computer-animated film created by Blue Sky Studios and released by 20th Century Fox. It was directed by Carlos Saldanha and Chris Wedge from a story by Michael J. Wilson. The story follows three Paleolithical mammals attempting to return a lost human baby to its parents. The film stars Ray Romano, John Leguizamo, Denis Leary, and Goran Visnjic.

Source: Wikipedia, "Ice Age (film)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

119185.name: The Invincible Iron Man

videogameversion.150461: North American Game Boy Advance edition

119185.description:
The Invincible Iron Man is the title of a video game published by Activision and developed by Torus Games for the Game Boy Advance in 2002. It is a one-player side-scrolling action game in which the player battles various villains from the Iron Man and comic book series.
Contents
Gameplay

"The basic design has you traveling sideways, upward, and back and forth throughout massive levels full of armed opponents. You can use Iron Man's repulsor blasts and shoulder tackle to knock out his enemies, but each use drains a little bit more of the costume's energy. When the energy is depleted, you'll need to collect energy items scattered throughout the level or wait for the suit to recharge. ... There are also power orbs located in various areas, which you can collect in order to unleash a massive chest-mounted cannon or to detonate a bomb that clears the entire screen of enemies. Iron Man's jump ability is actually a boost that you can use in combination with the shoulder tackle in order to fly short distances." Villains include Iron Man's cousin Morgan Stark, Blizzard, and the Crimson Dynamo.

Source: Wikipedia, "The Invincible Iron Man (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

119186.name: Iridion II

videogameversion.150462: North American Game Boy Advance edition

videogamehonor.30927: 2003 Spike Best Handheld/Mobile Game of the Year Nominee

119186.description:
Iridion II is a scrolling shooter video game developed by Shin'en and published by Majesco Games and Sierra Entertainment in North America and PAL regions respectively for the Game Boy Advance handheld video game console. It is the sequel to Iridion 3D.

Story

After the events in Iridion 3D, the forces of the Iridion disappeared completely which prompted mankind to travel into space and colonize the planets of the Iridion home galaxy. However, after hundreds of peaceful years, the Iridion Empire returned and attacked the human colonists with the intent of retaking their planets. The player assumes control over the SHN-27 en route to save mankind from the Iridion once more.

Gameplay

Players piloted the SHN-27 through three different modes of play, although Story Mode had to be cleared in order to unlock the other modes in the game such as Arcade and Challenge.
In Story mode, players followed an extremely simplistic plot involving the defense fleet chasing the Iridion forces through five different solar systems in three areas each, although each area is symbolized as a planet (including asteroid belts and space travel zones). There were a total of fifteen levels each ending in a boss battle. The other modes included Arcade and Challenge mode, the latter being a boss-attack mode.
Players had to select from one of six weapons at the beginning of each stage, but they could also select and change weapons during game play once a green power-up was collected. Players could also use the Power-ups to empower firing strength or replenish the ship's armor. The green power-ups also increased the shot count by adding two Satellites (or Options) that saddled alongside the ship. The player could change the position of the Satellites depending on the ship's movement, but only while the ship was not firing. Players could also collect Bomb pick-ups and could stock up a total of three. The player's ship was also equipped with a charge shot that, once fully charged, would unleash a very powerful plasma blast. The ship had an armor gauge that once depleted would destroy the ship completely and the players would have to start from a checkpoint.
A unique feature to the game included a brief music mode in the game's main menu where players could change the Lead, Chords, Bass and Drums to the title theme through four different songs.

Source: Wikipedia, "Iridion II", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

119188.name: It's Mr. Pants

videogameversion.150464: North American Game Boy Advance edition

119188.description:
It's Mr. Pants (originally Donkey Kong Coconut Crackers) is a video game for the Game Boy Advance. The starring character, Mr. Pants, is the result of a poorly drawn image from Rare's website, who was used as a mascot for the site survey.
Gameplay

The basic idea of the game is to create rectangles which have to be 2x3 blocks or larger to clear them from the grid. Blocks cannot be placed on top of blocks of the same color that are already on the grid, but they can be placed on top of blocks of any other color which causes the different blocks on the grid to disappear.
The game incorporates three main game modes: Puzzle, Wipeout and Marathon. There is also a fourth game mode called "Max's Mystical Muddle" which is opened up by completing all of the puzzles in Puzzle mode.

Source: Wikipedia, "It's Mr. Pants", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

119189.name: Blue Wing Blitz
119189.description:
Blue Wing Blitz is a Japanese-exclusive tactical role-playing game developed and published by Square. Unlike standard tactical video games, Blue Wing Blitz focuses on aerial battles, fought with aircraft, which can be customized. The events of the game begins in the Esk Republic, in an unnamed fictional world. Esk is threatened by the militaristic empire of Ordia, and the player's party is given the mission to repel the invasion.

Source: Wikipedia, "Blue Wing Blitz", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

119190.name: Buffers Evolution
119190.description:
User Summary

The game box describes this as an action race game. You play as a cyborg animal made from junk parts. For each stage you must traverse a multi path platform course trying to find a set number of parts in the shortest amount of time. Can you find the quickest route to complete the stage and lay down the fastest lap?

119191.name: Dicing Knight
119191.description:
User Summary

Dicing Knight was a winner in the WonderWitch (a homebrew development kit) competition and was one of the last games to be released on the Wonderswan. You play as a knight who must traverse a randomly generated dungeon looking for keys that to grant you access to higher floors and eventually a boss battle. Once a boss is defeated you are presented with a new and more difficult dungeon to face. The fighting system is rather unique in that for every hit taken or delivered a dice pops out to determine how much damage is dealt. Some enemies will drop goodies, such as time freezes, fortune, invincibility and new abilities such as a drill arm.These items which can be stored and used at later date. Their effects only last for a limited period.

Strangely for a Japan only release all in game text is in English

119192.name: Judgement Silversword: Rebirth Edition
119192.description:
User Summary

A winner of the WonderWitch (an official homebrew development kit for the WonderSwan) Development Competition in 2001 Judgement Silversword is a vertically scrolling bullet hell shoot em up. Your spaceship is equipped with three weapons that you can cycle through at will. A wide angle spread, a powerful forward shot and a shield which forms a bubble at the front of the ship that can also do damage if held against enemies. There are 30 levels and 3 difficulty settings.

119193.description:
Strange noises are heard from the Mad Mansion of Doctor Doom. Clouds of all colors come out of the chimney, and people tell weird stories about crazy creatures seen in the forest around the mansion. Help Doctor Doom finish his extravagant experiments to create the world's wackiest and craziest creatures ever seen!

In Crazy Creatures of Dr. Doom (a.k.a. Dr. Gloom in the U.S. release), all players try to get rid of their cards as cards in hand score penalty points at the end of a round. The player with the fewest penalty points at the end of the game wins and becomes Doctor Doom's new apprentice!
119193.name: Crazy Creatures of Dr. Doom

119194.description:
Long, long ago there was a mysterious village called Blackmore situated in a beautiful forest with giant trees and small forest roads. The town was home to a group of witches, and they lived their lives full of magic, sending out dark magic spells. Over all those years, however, no one was able to control the Witches Wheel, until now...

In The Witches of Blackmore, you try to control the Witches Wheel as long and as often as you can. Every witch that you catch in your tricks gives you Magic Points, and whoever collects the most Magic Points wins and gains control of the Witches Wheel until the end of time.
119194.name: The Witches of Blackmore

119196.name: Realm of the Undead
119196.description:
From the cassette inlay:

To you has fallen the task of rescuing the villagers and killing the Dark Lord. To do this you must travel through the Realms of the Undead collecting as much garlic as you can and avoiding the deadly bite of tarantulas, the kiss of the vampires and the caress of the zombies. On being caught by one of the servants of the Dark Lord you will lose one clove of garlic and when your supply has expired you shall most surely perish. However, if you are bitten by Dracula three times, although you do not perish, you are banished to the outskirts of his realm and have to recommence your original task rescuing the villagers and then return to the final confrontation with Dracula. Throughout the game are secret doors and levers which, on use, provide interesting results that may, or may not, be beneficial to your quest.

119197.name: The Black Hole
119197.description:
From the cassette inlay:

THE SCENE: Alien spacecraft are using hyperspace drive to enter our universe through a black hole. Their intent is destruction.

YOUR MISSION: To uphold the defence of your universe as long as possible while inflicting the maximum damage on alien forces.

YOUR WEAPONS: Positive and Negative Ion Guns are deadly at any range but the ion stream is bent by the massive gravitational field of the Black Hole. The Neutron Blaster is equally deadly but has only limited range.

YOUR BATTLE: You are under constant attack from the alien force which pits fiendish offence craft against you in ever increasing intensity in deadlier and deadlier form.

How long can your fleet of ships survive?
How many enemy craft can you destroy?

119198.name: Everest Ascent
119198.description:
User Summary

Starting with funding of £1000, the player must purchase sherpas, resources and tools in an aim to reach the top of Mount Everest. During the ascent, random pitfalls can befall the explorer, but if unprepared you may be able to make it back down the mountain to restock your supplies. And who knows, you may have received further sponsorship during the failed attempt.

119199.name: Mad Martha
119199.description:
From the cassette inlay:

Poor little Henry is the hen-pecked hero of this domestic tale. One night Henry can take no more. He steals his wages from his wife's purse, sneaks out of the house being careful not to wake the baby or trip over the cat, and heads for the bright lights to have some fun. Trouble is he runs out of money. His only way to raise some cash is to gamble his few remaining pounds on the spinning wheel of the roulette table.

Just as Henry is getting into his evening at the tables his wife - Mad Martha - has noticed his absence. Realising Henry has absconded with the housekeeping she sets out after him with an axe.

Guess what part you play in this happy tale? That's right, you are Henry. Watch out for that axe!

User Summary:

A combination of primarily traditional text adventure with the occasional graphical action screen.

119200.name: SuperTed
119200.description:
From the cassette inlay:

Texas Pete and his dastardly cronies Bulk and Skeleton are at large in Creepy Castle, and their plan is to blow it sky-high. Your mission is to catch them all and put them behind bars before the bomb goes off. But beware - there are hazards lurking in the castle which can rob you of your magic powers just when you need them most, making it easier for the gang to carry out their plot.

Can you guide SuperTed through the castle's twisting maze of corridors and paths to find Texas Pete, Bulk and Skeleton in time? Can you help to jail all the crooks before one of them has a chance to escape? Will the technological teddy be able to foil their foul felony? Why not play the game and see!

119201.name: Voyage into the Unknown
119201.description:
From the cassette inlay:

You are one of the last remaining Earthlings left alive after the last Great War. Information has come to your that the forces of the Death Star are amassing again to deliver the coup de grace to Earth. Self preservation and the belief in the liberty of mankind has forced you into a decision to find the Death Star and destroy it. Having made your way to the local launch pad and found a space ship ready for launch, you board. Unfortunately your knowledge of space ships is minimal. Following the logical course of switching on the engines, powering up and applying ignition, you barely have time to strap yourself in before the 'g' forces thrust you harder into your seat.

History has told you that within the Universe there is a Crystal capable of destroying the Death Star. The search is on. Should you find the all powerful Crystal and locate the Death Star, your mission depends on implanting the Crystal and your personal survival depends upon the destruction of the guarding androids and negotiating the Maze of Total Blackness.

119202.name: Phineas and Ferb Funniest Card Game Ever!
119202.description:
Goal: Players try to match the characters to the correct scene. The player with the most points from completed scenes when the last card is drawn wins.

The game comes with 2 decks of cards (68 blue-backed and 12 green-backed) plus 9 cardboard characters. To start the game players claim the characters one at a time and are dealt 3 blue cards. Then a green card is turned up. Players take turns drawing 1 blue card and playing 1 blue card. Here are the different types of cards in the game:


Green-backed cards = These cards give special responsibilities to the player who holds Agent P or Dr. Doofenshmirtz. For example "Say 'Ahh, Perry the Platypus!' before you start your turn. If you forget, you turn is over!" These cards also give the indicated player an extra penalty or bonus. For example "You may play 1 extra card." A new green-backed card is flipped over and takes effect whenever the Agent P or Dr. Doofenshmirtz character moves to another player.
Blue-backed Character Cards = These cards move the characters around. For instance "Take 1 character from another player."
Blue-backed Power Cards = These cards give you special card-play powers. For instance "Take 1 random card from each player."
Blue-backed Challenge Cards = These cards allow you to do weird challenges against other players. For instance "Challenge another player to a game of Rock-Paper-Scissors. If you win, take up to 3 random cards from the other player.
Blue-backed Scene Cards = These cards are how you score points. If you have the character(s) shown on the card you can play it for the number of points indicated on the card. For instance the "Unfair Science Fair" card is worth 10 points if you currently hold Baljeet.
Blue-backed Special Cards = The Mom card forces everyone to discard everything and draw 3 new cards. The 50 Bonus Points card gives 50 points to the player holding it at the end of the game.

119203.name: Starship Enterprise
119203.description:
From the cassette inlay:

The once proud Federation fleet lies in ruins, devastated by an alien force of immense power. As Captain of the sole surviving Starship your mission is vital, find and destroy the enemy ships that menace the galaxy. The Starship at your disposal is the most powerful and sophisticated ever built by the Federation. It's computer and weapons systems are second to none. You MUST NOT fail, the continued existence of the Federation and the Human Race depends on you.

119204.name: Phineas And Ferb 104 Days Of Summer Board Game
119204.description: With Phinneas & Ferb 104 Days of Summer Board Game every day is a different adventure! The Goal of the game is to have a great time with your friends and earn the most 'Summer Fun' points to 'Win'! There are Mini games that challenge players' dexterity and skill mixed in with plain old luck. Each day of the week features a different activity type from 'Mental Monday' to 'Speedy Saturday'. Themed, multi purpose props bring elements of the show to life and are used in different and surprising ways during the game.

119205.name: Im Tiefenrausch: Schiffe und Piraten
119205.description:
user summary

This is a sourcebook for LodlanD for playing pirate campaigns and to have more encounters for the players. This book contains new ships and races from the RDL and rules for ship combat.


New ships
additional combat rules
creating new ships
pirates
New ship-guided weapon systems

119206.name: Das Leben unter Wasser:  Kompendium
119206.description:
user summary

This is the LodlanD sourcebook for living under water in dome complexes far away from ships and pirates. This book contains every thing a GM needs for creating advnetures in these cities.


rules for creating dome complexes
live under water
culture of the races that live in those domes
specific information of the races
Apparments in the domes

119207.name: Völkerband 1: Liberty
119207.description:
user summary

This LodlanD book contains the complete description of the two enemy races Libertys and Renegades and the region where they live. This includes typical cities, concerns new ships and equipment, also 4 ready-to-play heroes and the history of the two races.

It also contains 2 complete adventures.

119209.name: Interdictor
119209.description:
User Summary

One of the earliest flight sims to render its display in fully coloured 3D with landscape features that could be flown under and around (bridges and towers), depicting both moving land and air vehicles negotiating the scenery.

The general goal of the game is to capture all the airfields along a river valley, destroying (amongst other things) bridges and enemy trucks along the way. Straying away from the general direction of the valley ended up with the player flying into an unpopulated and blank landscape, so exploration was minimal.

119210.name: Versunkene Schätze, Spielleiter-Sichtschirm
119210.description:
user summary

The GM screen with all the short rules and tables from the core rules and the soucrebooks Liberty, Leben unter Wasser and Schiffe und Piraten

It comes with two colored maps RDL and Liberty (A2) and a 16 sided booklet with sunken ships (signed on the maps)
It contains also one adventure round those sunken ships

119211.name: Nick Faldo Plays The Open
119211.description:
From the back of the box:

Using an accurate 900 screen scrolling map of the Royal St. George's Golf Course in Sandwich, it's your change to beat the world's best. Chosen for the 1985 Open Championship, the Royal St. George's is prey to wind and weather. As Nick Faldo says "Its bunker can be terrifying - you'll need all the help your caddy can give you."

Free Bookley: History and map of the course and a hole-by-hole guide.

119212.name: Holed Out!!
119212.description:
From the back of the box:

Whether you're young or old, male or female, beginner or professional, Holed Out has been designed especially for you. You can play alone or use the varying skill levels to allow up to 4 players of differing abilities to be more equally matched against each other. The game controls have been carefully selected for simplicity so that even the youngest or inexperienced computer user can play Holed Out.

Included with the game is a well thought-out instruction manual giving all the information you will require and individual maps of all the 36 holes.

119213.name: Thundermonk
119213.description:
From the back of the box:

The Evil Demons have taken control of The Lonesome Monk's childhood home in his absence. The neighbouring peasants, led by local boy Jason, have tried in vain to gain back power. Brave horsemen bring The Lonesome Monk back from the Crusade to lead the rebellion against The Evil Demons. When he catches sight of his valley The Lonesome Monk is enraged at the devastation caused by The Evil Demons. This is war!

You can now lead The Lonesome Monk through the labyrinths of The Monastery against The Evil Demons. Collect the hidden treasure en route, and use the Golden Keys to unlock the Doors of Destiny. Keep your eyes peeled for the secret passages. You too could walk through walls!

119214.name: Cosmic Relief: Prof. Renegade to the Rescue
119214.description:
User Summary

When he presented his theory of an asteroid heading towards Earth, the scientific community snubbed Professor Eyestrain. Now, decades later, it turns out his predictions were true after all! Taking control of one of five adventurers, the player must brave the hazardous terrain of the Professor's last known location in attempt to find him before time runs out and the Earth is destroyed!

A platform / action adventure, each of the different characters has different abilities, enabling you to use some of the items you discover during your journey, but not others (e.g. only the French explorer can use the unicycle, and only the English explorer can use the cricket ball).

119215.name: Startrader
119215.description:
From the back of the box:

A strategic space adventure of epic proportions. Search the universe for segments of a puzzle that will enable you to save your galaxy from certain destruction...

FEATURES

800 unique planets spanning 112 different star systems
Professionally digitised sound effects and speech
20 different types of spacecraft
Real-time combat and docking sequences
Realistic trading with market fluctuations
Multi-screen icon based ship control system
Scientifically based realistic game structure
Every game can be a different game

119216.name: Dominance
119216.description:
It is the 21st Century! Time for something other than checkers.
Take area control and piece taking to a whole new level. There is no jumping, no king this or king that, just dominance!

The board starts empty and you must dynamically "spawn" in your pieces!

This is a new kind of game for you to play with family and friends. Dominance is easy enough for players of all ages, it is fast, giving you the chance to play best out of three in one night, yet still intense enough to challenge the competitive adults in your life.

Ever shifting area control and the ability to bring new pieces onto the game board from any side, give you a much different experience than other abstract games you might have played before.

The game can be used to teach the many different facets of tactical and strategic play. This game fits into the middle ground between checkers and chess. There is not much to learn in the way of rules. But there is a lot to learn about how to win!

Play it Online @ tabletopia.com

119217.name: Sixaxis Wireless Controller
119217.description:
Sixaxis (trademarked SIXAXIS) is a wireless gamepad produced by Sony for their PlayStation 3 video game console. It was introduced alongside the PlayStation 3 in 2006 and remained the console's official controller until 2008. The Sixaxis was succeeded by the DualShock 3, an updated version of the controller that, like the DualShock and DualShock 2 controllers, incorporates haptic technology – also known as force feedback. A Sixaxis controller can also be used with Sony's PSP Go via Bluetooth after registering the controller on a PlayStation 3 console.

The DualShock 3 was originally intended to be bundled with the PlayStation 3 in time for the console's launch. However, Sony was in the midst of appealing a decision from a 2004 lawsuit involving patent infringement claimed by Immersion. The two companies were at odds over the haptic feedback technology used in earlier PlayStation controllers. The legal battle led to a decision to remove the vibration capabilities from the PS3 controller's initial design, which became known as Sixaxis.

The term "sixaxis" is also used to refer to the motion-sensing technology in PlayStation 3 controllers. It is a contraction of "six axis", which refers to the ability to sense motion in all axes of the six degrees of freedom. The term is also a palindrome.

Source: Wikipedia, "Sixaxis," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

The Sixaxis wireless controller was originally released with earlier versions of the PS3. The Sixaxis was replaced by the DualShock 3 which is nearly identical but adds the haptic feedback – also known as force feedback ("rumble" feature) that the Sixaxis lacked.

119218.name: Xor
119218.description:
User Summary

In this game, the player controls two shield-like characters, Magus and Questor, and must negotiate 15 levels of the game to escape. With the levels playable in any order, the player has a grand total of 2000 moves to complete them all. Each level is a maze with the two shields starting in different locations. The player can switch between the two controllable characters at any time, and must collect all the balloons present on the level before reaching the exit with either character. Perils to be negotiated are fish (which fall vertically down if their support is removed), and chickens (which 'fall' similarly to the left if anything blocking them is removed).

119219.description:
Created at Global Game Jam 2012

Emerging and adapting, newly formed life evolves on a decaying creature.

The goal in Saprobiont is to accumulate the most Biomass for your species to avoid extinction. Players earn Biomass by controlling Zones as well as by other species-specific means. The player with the most Biomass at the end of the game wins.

The species are:

The Swarm - Places tokens twice each turn. Gets a biomass bonus when controlling four or more zones.

The Shredder - Gets a Biomass bonus for killing enemies

The Canker - Placing tokens in a zone converts enemy tokens. Gains a Biomass bonus for of their tokens at end of the game.

The Ampulex - Placing in a zone, moves enemy tokens out forcing new conflict. Earn bonus biomass for tokens killed in this way.
119219.name: Saprobiont

119220.name: TechnoClash
119220.description:
From the back of the box:

As Ronaan, Wizard Prince of the Inner Realm, your task is clear: Defend your world from the technoscourge unleashed by the Robot Lord. With your loyal bodyguards at your side, you step through an intere-dimensional portal to Earth, a world where the evil of technology runs rampant. Prepare for the ultimate battle between magic and machines-prepare for TechnoClash!

9 combat weapons & spells, two bodyguards to choose from, 4 non-combat spells heal you, levitate you, teleport you and make you invulnerable. Indar, the Hawk of Second Sight, gives you a magical birds eye view of each battlefield. 7 unique locations with up to 9 levels each.

119221.name: Funny World / Balloon Boy
119221.description:
From the back of the box:

Get ready for a challenging and hysterical shooter that the whole family will enjoy! 30 levels of side-splitting mayhem. Shoot the enemies that race across the screen - but beware - no one will be laughing if you shoot the princess!

119224.name: Earth Defense
119224.description:
From the back of the box:

Only YOU can come to the Earth's defense! 5 colossal, awesome, fantastic levels of shooting, bombing and total destruction. 2 player simultaneous interplanetary combat...or fly solo! All types of secret weapons, enemies and huge bosses that eagerly attempt to destroy you! It is now time to bravely climb into the cockpit of the top-secret Phoenix Spitfire and defend the Earth!

119225.name: The Amanda Knox Board Game
119225.description:
The Amanda Knox Game is a board game based on the true events of November 1, 2007 in Perugia, Italy. Each player takes on the role of an individual present at the crime scene and pursues variable, hidden goals.

Decisions are made in real time. A sand timer is moved along a time track at the bottom of the board advancing fifteen minutes each turn. A die roll moves the player around the four-bedroom ground-floor apartment depicted on the game board.

Players must make choices that may alter or recreate historical events.

119226.name: Spot Goes to Hollywood
119226.description:
Spot Goes to Hollywood is a platform video game released by Virgin Interactive for the Mega Drive/Genesis as the sequel to Cool Spot. It utilizes an isometric graphics system to provide a pseudo-3D playing experience. The player controls Spot, once the mascot for the 7 Up soft drink, as he travels to various places trying to free his friends. Spot has somehow become trapped in a movie projector. As he jumps from film to film, he encounters many classic film genres; these make up the various levels of the game. The main levels are a pirate movie, an adventure movie, and a horror movie, but there are many other bonus films to unlock.

Source: Wikipedia, "Spot Goes To Hollywood", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

119227.name: Shove It!...The Warehouse Game
119227.description:
From the back of the box:

You're Stevedore the warehouse man. You shove boxes for a living. Now you've got a big job ahead of you, 16 levels, 160 warehouses that need to have their boxes shoved into order. Each room is a puzzle that takes skill, strategy and your wits to solve.

119228.name: Red Bird Baseball
119228.description: A small metal ball is hit by a spinning batter. The hole it falls into names the result of the play. The game probably commemorates the ST. LOUIS CARDINALS Baseball team and was made by The Measuregraph Co. of ST. LOUIS, MO. This game is shown in the BASEBALL GAMES BOOK BY MARK COOPER, M.D. OF SCHIFFER BOOKS.

119229.name: WWE Power Chipz
119229.description:
From Topps' website: WWE Power Chipz is ready to become the latest hit with WWE's legion of fans! With over 140 Chipz to collect, look for your favorite WWE superstars including John Cena, The Miz, Rey Mysterio, Divas, and WWE Legends. Gamers will have 6 action-packed games to play with a special magnetic powerball. Roll your powerball over your Chipz, and watch to see how many you can get to stick. The more Chipz that stick, the more points you earn! Plus, special Ruby, Silver, and Gold Chipz give you bonuses!

In this game you lay out different WWE Power Chipz on the ground and take turns rolling a magnetic ball. Each WWE Power Chipz poker style chip features a wrestler and a star power. After rolling the magnetic ball, you claim whichever chips are stuck to the ball.

After all of the chips have been collected, you add up your total scores and whoever has the highest score is the winner.

119230.name: Trick Shot
119230.description:
From the back of the box:

Line up your cue, take your best shot! Touch, English and cushion bounce simulate a real pool table. There are trophies for winners. Practice modes improve your game. Nine trick shot situations progress from easy to difficult. Added practice modes help you sharpen your judgement and skill to sink the toughest combinations. Match play gives you the game of Mini Pool and English Billiards. Your cue is your joystick. Your finesse controls the force and English of all your shots. Your only limit knowing all the right angles.

119231.name: Fear for Sale: Sunnyvale Story
119231.description:
Take on another incredible mystery in Fear for Sale: Sunnyvale! Investigate a strange murder and get to the bottom of a complicated case. After making it to the scene of the crime, a deputy is kidnapped by a terrifying ghost house that appears out of nowhere! Discover the connection between the latest murder, and another killing that occured many years ago. Put your detective skills to use and appease the ghosts in Fear For Sale: Sunnyvale!

Source: The Publisher Website.

119232.name: Pigs in Space
119232.description:
From the back of the box:

You command the Swinetrek. Your mission: to protect the galaxy from the villainous Gonzo. Armed with the weirdest assortment of weapons ever invented for a video game, you battle killer meatballs, pizza-hurling robots, and flock after flock of fearsome space chickens.

119233.name: Coconuts
119233.description:
From the back of the box:
Coco the crazy monkey is on the loose again! Hurling coconuts down on our intrepid jungle explorer, Stanley. Help Stanley avoid those falling coconuts. The better you do, the crazier Coco gets and the faster the coconuts fly.

119234.name: Squids
119234.description:
Steev, Vahine and the rest of the Squids are in danger! An infectious black ooze is corrupting their world. Only a few heroes can fight back and save their lush underwater kingdoms! Recruit a small army of stretchy Squids and lead them into turn-based battles against the dark hordes.

Source: The Game Website.

119235.name: Orbit
119235.description:
From Introduction in the beginning of the book:

The Orbit game system (fully explained in this one book) covers individual characters, items, armies, starship battles, planets, weapons, governments, and galaxies.

Then, there's a long list of different alien races, creatures, androids, and pirates & other assorted rogues. Although, unlike other science-fiction adventure, or "space opera" roleplay games, your character may meet any of them, or even be any of them, too.

That's just one thing which makes Orbit different from the rest. Added to that, the system itself is easy to understand and flexible.

No level-limits on careers.
No penalties based on gender.
No boundaries on your imagination.
Welcome to Orbit, roleplaying the way it was meant to be.

119236.name: Rei 1.0
119236.description:
From the introduction:

This campaign is a set of linked scenarios, to be played in order. However, if modified slightly, they can also be used separately as mini-adventures.

As mini-adventures, each should take only an hour or two to play. Although the Game Ref may enhance the stories somewhat to make them longer if he, or she, wishes. While the full campaign will probably last for at least several hours.

The suggested character level for this module is 5th thru 7th. Although, like with all Orbit campaign modules, the level of challenge may be altered quite easily by the Game Ref by simply adjusting the level of NPCs and other encounters, many of which are listed in the Aliencyclopedia at the back of this module.

119237.name: Princess Natasha

videogameversion.150755: North American Game Boy Advance edition

119237.description:
The games for the Game Boy Advance and Nintendo DS are relatively similar. They're comic book styled and have pretty good graphics, even though they were created when both devices were newly made. The plot is Lubek has a secret base where he's manufacturing robots that turn civilians into zombies. Natasha must destroy every robot and spray the zombies with the dezombifier.your menu selection is located on your BooferBerry where you can select where you want to go. There are three chapters and at the end of each chapter there is a big boss battle. Each level has enemies that you must destroy and zombies you must save. At the end of each level, Natasha holds out two fingers as a peace sign and winks at you. there are a wide variety of robots in the game. there are little spherical robots - medium size spherical robots which when destroyed release two little robots - and big spherical robots which when destroyed releases two medium size robots. If you were to destroy One big spherical robot, you would have to destroy six other robots, 7 in total. There are flying robots which propel themselves in the air. One of the two swoop down and try to hit you and the other fires projectiles at you. There are few robots which stay on the ground. One of them walks back and forth until you stand next to it. Once you're in his path his feet will start spinning at a fast speed. The second just walks backs and forth and won't harm you unless he swings his arms at you. He usually misses every swing.
There are special levels in the game. They can be found on the map at random times and every special level has a different objective. You could either have to save the zombies or destroy all enemies, but you have to do this in less than a minute. If you get hit once, you'll have to redo everything.
Once you beat the game, at the end it will give you a link to a website that will give you codes. You can input the codes in the EXTRA menu screen.
There are three codes: 1 - Infinite lives 2 - More levels 3 - All Gadgets
The link to the codes is no longer up, although you can find the codes elsewhere on the web.

Source: Wikipedia, "Princess Natasha", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

119238.name: Hollywood Squares (Wii/iOS/PS3)
119238.description:
User summary:

Adaptation of the Hollywood Squares TV game show, featuring its most recent host Tom Bergeron and using the familiar tic-tac-toe celebrity board.

119239.name: Concentration
119239.description:
From the back of the game cover:

Based on the classic TV game show, Concentration is two games in one: matching and puzzling. Match the scrambled pieces behind the numbered panels, turning two of them over at a time to reveal a portion of the hidden puzzle picture for you to solve. If you guess correctly, you could be on your way to the bonus round.

119240.name: WW2 All At Sea
119240.description:
Miniature Rules for World War Two Naval Warfare

Scale:

tactical turn = 10 minutes
strategic turns = 40 minutes
4 cm = one nautical mile
1 model = one ship or four or five aircraft.

Player's take the role of squadron or fleet commander. One die per battery. If a hit is scored, another die is rolled to determine the damage. AA fire is handled a bit differently with each ship having a number of Light AA, and AA dice dependent upon armament. Within certain restrictions these dice may be allocated to more than one enemy flight per turn as required.

Radar can be useful to detect enemy forces. Once forces come within visual range, firing is likely to commence. Damage rates may seem high. It is quite possible for a destroyer to be sunk in a single round of combat. Ships suffer damage which includes degradation of firepower, speed, or C3 systems.

C3 systems and formation command are simulated with each formation's flagship maneuvering and any ships in formation with it will conform. Ships not in the flagship’s formation roll a die to determine whether they may maneuver.

ref: http://mcmdgames.blogspot.com/2012/01/ww2-all-at-sea review.html

119244.name: Harobots
119244.description:
User Summary

Harobots is a Pokemonesque RPG collect and battle game. It teams you with a Haro (a small round green robot from the Gundam anime series) and challenges you to become the strongest HaroBot battler. In battle the Haros channel the powers of various other mecha from the Sunrise anime series and over 100 make an appearance. Items and parts can be collected to improve your Haro and enhance its skills. The game also features 4 mini games that act as training for your bot and can be used to increase its strength, speed, the power of your various attacks and stamina.

119245.name: Dreamland
119245.description:
Welcome to Dreamland, an old abandoned amusement park! It is full of dangerous traps and entertainment not suitable for children. And it also contains a terrible secret... There is an evil dwarf who lives here, brightens up his miserable days by collecting the souls of those who dare enter the neglected park. And he's got a plan on how to get your soul. Only you can rid the world from his presence, but it won’t be easy. His traps and tests are waiting for you. You'll need to make your way around the park looking for useful things in all the old rides. You'll have to opens a number of locks, outsmart the swindlers in the shell game, fire the cannon on the Pirate Ship and blast off to the Moon. There's no turning back. You need to get to the safe where the evil dwarf keeps his contracts for all the lost souls. Contracts that were signed in blood. Moreover one of these contracts has your younger brother's name on it – and another one personally for you with yours!

Amazing graphics, animations, and an excellent soundtrack all make Dreamland a unique game with a great mix of hidden objects, puzzles and adventure. Step right up to the big top and don't pass it by!

Source: The Publisher Website.

119246.name: Agenten, Händler, Sicherheit und Medien
119246.description:
user summary

This is a Scerario book for LodlanD and it contains imformation about agents, traders, securiy and media. The GM gets complete information and small adventures and adventure ideas to create a wonderfull campaign with this kind of occupations.


advenure ideas for a big campaign
adventures
special equipment
complete rules for trading

119247.name: 100 sE: Lod & Leute
119247.description:
user summary

The council of territory reaches it 100 year. This book gives the GM informations about all new historical and political changes since the Core rules was published. It contains a travel guide of the City Lod and a complete adventure.


political and social changes since 98sE.

summary of all equipment published yet
travelguide Lod
adventure

119248.name: Völkerband 2: Teikoku
119248.description:
user summary

This is the sourcebook for LodlanD with the region of "Japan". Teikoku is a region of the world forgotten and unknown by the RDL. This book combines sience fiction elements with fantasy part to give a complete new "world" for the players.


new cultures
the houses and apparments in Teikoku
new ships
new equipment
rules for the special combat

119249.name: Gefahren unter Wasser
119249.description:
user summary

This is the sourcebook for LodlanD with all the danger that a living under water can come to the heroes. It also contains a complete adventure and many advneture ideas with the trouble under water theme.


the network
sickness & epidemic
iceberg, methane bubble, thermocline
creatures
lunatic fringes, sects
criminal consortia
rules for building torpedos

119250.name: Chaos und Ordnung: Arbiträa & BFS
119250.description:
user summary

This is a sourcebook for LodlanD which contains the description of two countries in the RDL including a complete Scenario.


Arbiträä, form of government and society
Arbiträä, the piratehunters
BFS, all kind of resitance
BFS, all about the clones
travel guide to all big cities
short stories
adventure for both countries
new ships with inner maps

119252.name: LodlanD 1.5 Grundregelwerk
119252.description:
user summary

This is the new Core Rules including a update of the first edition with a First play adventure, redesigned sips, eight complete new submarines new layout and a hardcover printing.

The 1.5 core rules are still compatible with all source- and adventure books from the first edition.

119253.name: Blut und Stahl: UNL & Stawa
119253.description:
user summary

This sourcebook for LodlanD contains the two allied countries Stawa and UNL. The book conatins information and small adventure to create a campaign in the region of this mighty alliance and their many enemies.

119254.name: 6 Archon Feats
119254.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Sometimes rules supplements read like the world-setting bible of frustrated novelists. While solid world-building is a useful skill, you don’t always need four paragraphs of flavor text to tell you swords are cool, magic is power, shadows are scary, and orcs are savage. Sometimes a GM doesn’t have time to slog through a page of history for every magic weapon. Sometimes all that’s needed are a few cool ideas, with just enough information to use them in a game. Sometimes, all you need are bullet points.


1 With A Bullet Point is a line of very short, cheap PDFs each of which gives the bare bones of a set of related options. It may be five spells, six feats, eight magic weapon special abilities, or any other short set of related rules we can cram into about a page. Short and simple, these PDFs are for GMs and players who know how to integrate new ideas into their campaigns without any hand-holding, and just need fresh ideas and the rules to support them. No in-character fiction setting the game world. No charts and tables. No sidebars of explanations and optional rules. Just one sentence of explanation for the High Concept of the PDF, then bullet points.


The High Concept: Six feats designed to augment the options and utility of archons (from The Genius Guide to the Archon) or, if archons aren't being used in a campaign, that can be taken by warrior-wizards of other classes and multiclasses (replacing archon levels prerequisites with a base attack bonus and caster level of the same value).

The feats included are:


Add Invocation to Injury
Eldritch Insight
Second Spell-Weapon
Spell-Weapon
Spell-Weapon Charge
Spell-Weapon Gestures

119255.name: Illfrost: Temple Approach
119255.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Jonathan Roberts cartographer for Kobold Quarterly, The Breaking of Forstor Nagar, and Adventures in the Hyborian Age, presents another Fantastic Map: Illfrost: Temple Approach.

This multi-page PDF allows you to print out the battlemap at a 1 square=1 inch scale as a letter-format or A4 map and is also available in a printer-friendly light grayscale version. The pack also contains a High-Resolution JPEG of the map with grid and a MapTool file set up for quick use in a 4E, PFRPG, or any OGL game.

The Ancient Temple map originally appeared in the 4e adventure Illfrost: Bondage.

119256.name: Illfrost: Ancient Temple
119256.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Jonathan Roberts cartographer for Kobold Quarterly, The Breaking of Forstor Nagar, and Adventures in the Hyborian Age, presents another Fantastic Map: Illfrost: Ancient Temple.

This multi-page PDF allows you to print out the battlemap at a 1 square=1 inch scale as a letter-format or A4 map and is also available in a printer-friendly light grayscale version. The pack also contains a High-Resolution JPEG of the map with grid and a MapTool file set up for quick use in a 4E, PFRPG, or any OGL game.

The Ancient Temple map originally appeared in the 4e adventure Illfrost: Bondage.

119257.name: Illfrost: Temple Dungeons
119257.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Jonathan Roberts cartographer for Kobold Quarterly, The Breaking of Forstor Nagar, and Adventures in the Hyborian Age, presents another Fantastic Map: Illfrost: Temple Dungeons.

This multi-page PDF allows you to print out the battlemap at a 1 square=1 inch scale as a letter-format or A4 map and is also available in a printer-friendly light grayscale version. The pack also contains a High-Resolution JPEG of the map with grid and a MapTool file set up for quick use in a 4E, PFRPG, or any OGL game.

The Ancient Temple map originally appeared in the 4e adventure Illfrost: Bondage.

119260.name: Illfrost: Bondage
119260.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Forged by Envy - Tempered by Malice

In the century that has passed since settling into the eastern continent of Lannithir, the four kingdoms of men have seen their share of struggle and conflict. Through their continued growth and expansion they have discovered many ancient ruins of a time long past. It was within one such set of these ruins that an expedition of explorers from Kazdim uncovered, and released, an unspeakable horror. A dread so unimaginable the ancients themselves imprisoned it over a thousand years ago. This evil has a name... Necrath, The Ice Duke.

In the decade and a half that has passed since this wicked scourge was loosed upon the land, strange, dark, and violent events have taken place. Sinister books and scrolls of vile evil and black magic have been discovered, and have twisted the minds of those foolish enough to read them.
