Each player places snake pieces on the board, either continuing an existing snake, or ending one to start another. The snakes are scored once there are two ends, and the player with the majority of the pieces in that chain scores the points.

The board has 10 snakes on it, and each snake's eye holds a special token (hole, twist, cross). These are randomly chosen and placed by all players when starting the game. A hole is impassable, but a twist allows a player to twist any snake piece on the board. This can change things considerably! The cross is an intersection that ends all snakes that touch it.

Twisted Tails was created by Kevin Kulp and J. Tagmire at the 2012 Global Game Jam. This year's theme was Ouroboros.

119395.name: Fantasywelt (Issue 24 - 1989)
119395.description:
This issue contains the DSA / AD&D adventure "Ein unvergeßlicher Abend"

The published year is not proven

___
user summary

119396.name: DualShock 3 Wireless Controller
119396.description:
The DualShock 3 Wireless Controller (SCPH-98050/CECHZC2) is a gamepad for the PlayStation 3 that incorporates the design and features of the Sixaxis wireless controller with the haptic feedback capabilities of the DualShock and DualShock 2. The vibration function on the DualShock 3 does not interfere with the motion sensing function of the controller and both functions can be used at once. Like the Sixaxis, it is a wireless controller that uses both analog and digital signals simultaneously at all times and has a USB mini-B port for charging, as well as for playing while charging. It can also be used on a PSP Go via Bluetooth, but the controller and the PSP Go must be registered using a PS3.

Source: Wikipedia, "DualShock", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

119397.name: Genesis 6 Button Controller
119397.description:
The six button pad is slightly smaller than the three button pad and features three more face buttons (X, Y and Z), similar to the design of buttons on arcade fighting games. It was released in 1993, coinciding with the release of Street Fighter II: Special Champion Edition

Source: Wikipedia, "Sega Genesis", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

119398.name: Fantasywelt (Issue 32 - 1991)
119398.description:
This issue contains articles of heresy in roleplay, play-by-mail RPGs and AD&D computer games. It also contains an article about Live- Roleplay and a complete adventure for it.

no hint of a date in this issue
___
(user summary)

119399.name: Envoyer (Issue 135 - Feb 2008)
119399.description: This issue contains an adventure for 7th sea "Die Schatzkarte" and one adventure for Cthulhu "Das Zeitalter der Götter"

119401.name: Envoyer (Issue 136 - Mar 2008)
119401.description: This issue conatains the fantasy adventure "Das Ei der Welten" useable for example with DSA.

119402.name: Guilty Gear
119402.description:
Guilty Gear, subtitled The Missing Link in Japan, is the first game of the Guilty Gear series. Guilty Gear is set in 2D, similar to Street Fighter and The King of Fighters, but is fast-paced and focuses more on the use of combo techniques. The game features 10 characters and three hidden characters. It uses a six-button layout: Punch, Kick, Slash, H-Slash, Dust and Respect. Combat is one-on-one set in best-two-out-of-three rounds.

It uses a "tension" gauge, akin to Street Fighter Alpha's Super Combo techniques, in which characters can input certain commands and activate special-moves called Chaos Attacks. It also features an air-combo system, comparable to Marvel vs. Capcom's "Aerial Rave", allowing combos to be performed on airborne opponents.

Guilty Gear features instant kill techniques called Destroy Attacks, that can be activated after a Murder Outbreak attack successfully lands on an opponent, effectively ending the match.

The game also has a feature called Chaos Mode that is activated when a character's health is at the half-way point (yellow bar). A red aura will surround the character and he/she is able to perform unlimited Chaos Attacks.

Source: Wikipedia, "Guilty Gear", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

119403.name: Envoyer (Issue 137 - Apr 2008)
119403.description: This issue contains the description of a complete magical academy useable for fantasy roleplaying games.

119404.name: Four in a Square
119404.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Just as the Four in a Square suggests, you want to be the first player to form a square with four balls of your color.

On a turn, you place a ball of your color in an empty spot, then slide a board tile to try to get four of your color in a square. That's it!

videogame.69124: Alex Kidd in the Enchanted Castle

119405.name: Sega Genesis Classic Collection: Gold Edition

videogamecompilation.69124: Alex Kidd in the Enchanted Castle

119405.description:
User Summary

A good selection of 46 classic games for Mega Drive and Genesis. Released in four packs on Steam and in this collection containing all four packs content.

119406.name: Envoyer (Issue 138 - May 2008)
119406.description: This issue contains the adventure "Der andere Weg nach Kuz Alhadur" for Midgard

119407.description:
Jinx is a new Game in the Dixit family. Unlike the original game, the drawings are not realistic illustrations depicting scenes but more abstract images.
During the game, 9 cards are placed face-up in a 3x3 square. The active player draws a locator map that will show him which of the nine cards he will play with. This location is kept secret.

The player speaks, sings, or acts out something relating to this card (just as in "Dixit").
The other players go around and point to the card they think is correct. Only one player can point to each card. Once a player has chosen the right card, the turn stops. The player who finds the right card keeps it. Each card counts as a victory point. Players who were wrong give their cards to the active player. But if neither player gets the right card, the active player must return a previously won card.
119407.name: Dixit Jinx

119408.name: Fantasywelt:  Sonderausgabe 1
119408.description:
user summary

This a special issue of the periodical "Fantasywelt" including only two big adventures.


Der Henker von Boscût (5-7 players, AD&D)
Das Schwert des Eiszauberers (Solo adventure, 1 fighter, DSA)

119409.name: Envoyer (Issue 139 - Jun 2008)
119409.description: This issue contains an adventure for Discworld "Der eine Ring"

119410.name: Envoyer (Issue 140 - Jul/Aug 2008)
119410.description: This issue contains an adventure for Elyrion "Tödliche Liebe" and one adventure for Wushu "Mystic New York - Das schwarze Schwert"

119411.name: Envoyer (Issue 141 - Sep 2008)
119411.description: This issue contains the adventure "Eine Seereise" for 7th sea and a scenario for any fantasy world "Der Tempel des blinden Gottes"

119412.name: Envoyer (Issue 142 - Oct 2008)
119412.description: This issue contains the adventure "Hirte, Schaf und Wolf" for shadowrun.

119413.name: Brunhilda and the Dark Crystal
119413.description:
Embark upon an epic quest to save the Magical Realm in this delightful hidden object game. Explore a world blooming with magic and humor, visit the flying university, talk to the dragons and crash a flying broom! There are many adventure games, but Brunhilda and the Dark Crystal is unlike anything you've seen before!

Brunhilda Features:
Epic and engaging storyline
Over 6 hours of gameplay
All dialogues with full voice over
Beautiful hand drawn graphics
Arcane mini-games to master

Source: The Game Website.

119414.name: Envoyer (Issue 143 - Nov 2008)
119414.description:
This issue contains the adventure "Geisterschiff" for Midgard and one adventure for TORG "Bitte recht freundlich"

-

This is the last issue of the Envoyer magazine. Parts of the Envoyer are added to the periodical "Spielexpress"

119415.name: Staff of Karnath
119415.description:
The Staff Of Karnath is a video game for the Commodore 64 developed and released by Ultimate Play The Game in 1984. It was the first of a series to feature the aristocrat adventurer Sir Arthur Pendragon.

The game is set in a castle presented in a scrolling, oblique view. The aim of the game is to collect all pieces of a pentacle before midnight, in order to form the Staff Of Karnath. The pieces of the pentacle are guarded by various magical creatures, some of which can be defeated by casting spells, others requiring accurate timing and movement. Once a piece is obtained no more pieces can be collected until the pentacle is taken to a specific chamber within the castle.

Source: Wikipedia, "The Staff of Karnath," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

119416.name: Hell-Copter
119416.description:
Translated Back of the Box

Take control of the mightiest combat helicopters to bring stability back to the world, which lies in chaos at the end of the century.
Protect the innocent and destroy hostile fleets alone or with up to 4 players over LAN. Choose from three types of helicopters, the Vulture, Dragonfly or Scorpio, and go to war in 25 missions.

119417.name: Am Spinnrad
119417.description:
Objective:
be the first to move all of your five meeples forming a row within one of those black lines with white dots
- moving by turn -
players place their meeples into coloured start positions (spread all over the board)
players move their meeples to adjacent junctions
- allowed only if space isn't already occupied
try to find shortest way to rejoin your meeples - or block others if they could be faster than you
remarks:
produced before WWII

119418.name: Adventure Class Ships Volume 1 (Sleeved Set)
119418.description:
User summary:

A sleeved set containing 15mm deck plans for ten different Imperial, Zhodani, and independent vessels.

The included booklet contains complete stats for all the vessels and stats and plans for four small craft.

This product is identical to Adventure Class Ships Volume 1 (Boxed Set), except that it is shipped in a cardboard sleeve instead of a box and does not include the second booklet or the countersheet of figures.

119419.name: Time and Eternity
119419.description:
The game opens with a wedding between the main character and a woman named Toki, which is rudely interrupted by an attack. This brings out Toki’s meaner alter ego, Towa. After an undisclosed series of events, Toki finds herself flitting back and forth through the passage of time.

Makimono is a fortune teller who predicted the attack on the main character’s wedding, as shown in the opening of Tokitowa. Bikodo is the head of the assassin’s guild, who is introduced in a fight scene.

Source: Wikipedia, "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Toki_to_Towa,"; available under the CC-BY-SA License.

119420.name: The Witch and One Hundred Cavalry
119420.description:
Story
Deep within the forest, there live two witches: the beautiful marsh witch and the ugly forest witch. The two are engaged in a deadly war for supremacy. One day, the beautiful marsh witch encounters the legendary "one hundred cavalry", whom she then used magic summoned into the battle, in hope of gaining the upper hand against her rival.

Characters

Metallica
Metallica is a beautiful marsh witch and also is the main character of the story. She hopes to get rid of her long time rival, the forest witch, and fill the world with marshland.

One hundred cavalry
One of the one hundred cavalry that Metallica summoned. Although looks small on the outside, it's able to wield a large broadsword. It has great power but has lost most of its ability to cast magic. It's also lost the notion of morality and will do brutal things in battle. It does not fully accept Metallica as its master. This character will act as the player's avatar.

Source: Wikipedia, "Majo to Hyakkihei", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

119421.name: Wizard's Museum Construction Kit
119421.description:
Wizard’s Museum is a quick-to-play game of tile placement and set collecting for two to five players. During the course of a game, players take on the role of wizards in competition with one another as they try to build the best and most well-ordered museum of magical artifacts, all while sabotaging the efforts of their friends and colleagues.

Players manage a hand of tiles, drawing and playing a single tile each turn across their own and their opponents collections. Each tile features a magical artifact in its center and four magical gates on its edges. Tiles are played to match the edges of their neighbors, but points are won and lost by matching -- or failing to match -- artifacts. Will you add to your museum or disrupt your neighbors?

119422.name: Thunder Force
119422.description:
Thunder Force is a scrolling shooter computer game released by Technosoft in 1983. It is the first game in the Thunder Force series.

Source: Wikipedia, "Thunder Force", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

119423.name: Map It! US Edition
119423.description:
Map It! U.S. Edition uses the same game play as the German-language 'Ausgerechnet!' series of games: Players deal three piles of 15 location cards from a deck of roughly 200 cards (naming cities and landmarks in the U.S. for this edition). They take one deck of 15 cards and put one location card on the direction board, pointing north, south, east and west.

On a turn, a player draws a location card – keeping the latitude and longitude on the back of the card secret from all players – then places the card next to the direction board, indicating how they think this location relates to the starting one. Is Honolulu west of San Francisco? Why sure, so place it by the west arrow. Location cards can be placed between cards already on the board.

After each location card is placed, any player can challenge the positioning of that card. That player reveals the back of the most recently placed card as well as one adjacent card. If the challenge was correct – and the card placed wrongly – the challenger wins a point chip from the placer and the card is removed; otherwise the challenger hands over a chip to that person.

After 15 cards are placed, there is an interim scoring in which all players secretly guess how many cards have been placed correctly. Guess correctly, and you score two chips; if no one is spot on, the closest guesser wins a chip.

After three rounds and the final interim scoring, the player with the most chips wins.

119425.name: Ed, Edd n Eddy: Jawbreakers!

videogameversion.151216: North American Game Boy Advance edition

119425.description:
The object of the game is to help these resourceful preadolescents win a contest whose grand prize is a lifetime supply of jawbreakers. Throughout the game, Ed, Edd and Eddy will tap into their unique brand of resourcefulness as they earn money, solve physical puzzles, interact with their pals from the cul-de-sac and find hidden goodies. The players will control one Ed at a time, each with his own unique strength and weakness, and may dynamically cycle through the three main characters. Players will explore 12 levels, each offering a short animated cut-scene at the beginning and end. The Eds are the playable characters, each with their own skills and abilities. Ed can headbutt things, Edd (Double-D) can use a slingshot, a wrench and use switches that do different things. Eddy can use the hypnotizing wheel or the jetpack.

Source: Wikipedia, "Ed, Edd n Eddy: Jawbreakers", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

119426.name: Ed, Edd n Eddy: Scam of the Century
119426.description:
Ed, Edd n Eddy: Scam of the Century is an action game developed and published by D3 Publisher America for the Nintendo DS handheld console. The game is based on the popular, long-running Cartoon Network series, Ed, Edd n Eddy. The game was released on October 23, 2007 in the United States. In the game, the Eds run the risk of having their scams turned on them by the other kids in the neighborhood. Many of the objects and characters, as well as the visual style, borrow heavily from the cartoon.

Each Ed has his own set of levels to complete. They're all side-scrolling fare, but each Ed has his own style of movement and attacks. Edd throws dictionaries, Ed slams his head down on the enemies, while Eddy spits his gum at enemies (Although this freezes the enemy, it does not defeat them). Item pick-ups can be activated on the touch-screen.
On top of the platforming elements, the game contains a number of unlockable mini-games: Whack-a-Mole has been turned into "Whack a Zit" where players tap at rising pimples on Ed's back before they burst. There's also a pie-throwing challenge where players flick the desserts up at enemies on the top screen.[2] The game features 13 total stages, special attacks using the touch screen, the option to blow into the microphone to bring characters back to life, three side story mini-games and special items.

Source: Wikipedia, "Ed, Edd n Eddy: Scam of the Century", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

119427.name: High School Musical: Livin' the Dream

videogameversion.151231: North American Game Boy Advance edition

119427.description:
High School Musical : Livin' The Dream is a video game based on the 2006 and 2007 television movies High School Musical and High School Musical 2 available for the Nintendo Game Boy Advance.
[edit]Gameplay

The game features two modes: Story and Quick Play. In Story mode, players need to locate the stolen items and solve various puzzles to uncover the identity of the thief. The Quick Play mode allows players to dance to songs from High School Musical and High School Musical 2, including Breaking Free and What Time Is It?

Source: Wikipedia, "High School Musical: Livin' the Dream", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

119428.name: Into the Fray
119428.description:
Into the Fray is a print and play skirmish level fantasy war-game from Moss Games.

Into the Fray allows each player to take control of one of the factions of the Hundred Worlds. Each group attempting to uncover the secrets of the lost world of Gateway and crushing anyone who stands in their way.

Designed so that each player will field between 15 and 20 figures in a standard battle, a game of Into the Fray (ITF) will last about 2 hours with experienced players. The game includes rules for the standard fare like movement, combat and morale, and also includes a system for magic and special abilities that will keep things interesting, even for veteran players.

Available only in an electronic format, ITF is a print and play game. It keeps the initial cost down and allows you to make as many or as few miniatures as you need to form your army. With a few supplies (cardstock and glue sticks) and a few hobby tools (a hobby knife and a straightedge), you can build all of the cards, miniatures, counters and templates you need. Add in a handful of six siders and a tape measure and you will be ready to get Into the Fray!!

119429.name: Foreningsmappen
119429.description:
user summary

Handbook for rpg-associations

This book has a broad content with an emphasis on organizing volunteer work. It is easy to use and addresses everyone in the Danish gaming environment - individuals and societies, experienced and inexperienced.

The organizational module contains short summarized presentations around: Start of organizations, the general meeting, board work and cooperation, relevance and design of statutes, member participation, rules and responsibilities, bookkeeping, accounting, tax, audit, municipal aid, how to find support, make a magazine and to create good PR for your club.

The chapter on game environment contains descriptions of significant events, projects and forums, as well as a detailed description of Sleipner.

Last in the book you will find a collection of perspectives about the role-playing history, the Danish gaming environment history, role playing associations situation and prospects, as RPG playing, role-play as media, and about role playing and consciousness.

The book was published with the help of DUF (the national Danish Youth Association) and Sleipner (the former national Danish Roleplayers Association)

119430.name: PoPoLoCrois Monogatari II
119430.description:
User Summary

Actually the third game in the series it continues the story of young prince Pietro and the his friend the witch Narcia(both now aged 15) as they set out on an adventure to confront the goddess Maira who threatens the Kingdom.

The game features random turned based battles but with stategic elements. Once a fight begins you can still move on your turn, within a given range, in order to gain a more defensive or offensive position.

119431.name: Chameleon
119431.description:
"Chameleon - the game where you can run and you CAN hide!

Chameleon is a new and exciting board game that is a combination of Chess, Draughts, Chinese Checkers and Backgammon. It is a game of tactics, cunning and ambush.

Plan your attack, secure your defence, strike when ready.

Chameleon is played on 6 colour game board and comes with 12 pegs, 2 'chameleon' die, a rules booklet and a strategy brochure. Each player (either black or white) plays with 6 pegs that are red, yellow, green, blue, orange and purple.

The aim of the game is to be the first player to move all six tokens from your 'starting grid' into your 'home base' whilst trying to stop (or zap!) your opponent from doing the same. If you're on your own colour you are a chameleon and can't be seen. If you're off your colour you'd better watch out!"

119432.description:
The peaks of Snowdonia rise before you, encased in mist, their summits barely visible. The highest is Snowdon (Wyddfa) herself at 1,085 metres. The year is 1894, and the Snowdon Mountain Tramroad and Hotels Company Limited has been formed to build a branch line from Llanberis to the summit. You can scarcely believe it's possible!

In Snowdonia players represent work gangs providing labour for the construction of the Snowdon Mountain Railway. Unlike other train games you will have to excavate your way up a mountain side, as well as make and lay the track, construct viaducts and stations. All this in competition with the weather of the Welsh mountains (and the game itself)!

You may be assisted by a train (though that's not always best) and you'll be able to collect essential materials from the Stock Yard. You will obtain special work contracts that give you bonuses.

Can you contribute more than the other players to the magnificence of the Snowdon Mountain Railway?
119432.name: Snowdonia

119433.name: Thorwal Standard (Issue 17 - Mar 2011)
119433.description:
This is the last issue of the Thorwal Standard and it is only avalable for download.

This issue contains an article/rules for combats on sea and 2 adventures "Der Mann in Schwarz" and "Myrkdag"

119434.name: deSPIRIA
119434.description:
User Summary

An organisation known as "The Church" has taken global power after the devastation of World War III in 2070. The war left the world in a dark state, two thirds of the Earth's population having died and infant death rates skyrocketing for the survivors. Twenty two years later and one of the Church's undercover operatives, Alura Valentine, is involved in a train accident en route to assassinate an executive of the rival "Heretics Group". As the player, from this point you control Alura (a teenage girl with telepathic and other mental abilities that assist her in conversations and battles), and must explore RPG-style to try to find the truth of all the unusual events that have recently started occurring in Church-held lands.

119435.name: Thorwal Standard (Issue 16 - May 2002)
119435.description: This issue conatains an article about rune magic, and the second part of the Adventure "Die Stunde der Rache"

119436.name: Tâb
119436.description:
Tâb is a traditional Egyptian abstract game played in a number of Arabic-speaking countries. It is classified by the game historian R. C. Bell as a "running fight" game and by the game historian David Parlett as a "linear war" game. Games in these categories are relatively rare (Tablan, Puluc, and Daldos being virtually the only other known examples).

The game is played on a board with 4 rows and anywhere from 7 to 15 columns. One player fills the bottom row with playing pieces; the other player fills the top row with his or her pieces. Four casting sticks are used to randomly generate moves for the pieces. The two center rows of the board are treated as a looping track along which pieces move linearly in a counter-clockwise direction once leaving their home row. It is primarily on these two central rows that the battles take place, with a piece capturing an opponent piece by landing on its square. A few special movement rules add complexity and strategy to the game. A player wins by capturing all of the opponent's pieces.

There is some speculation among game historians that Tâb may be a descendent of the ancient Egyptian game of Senet (similarities include linear movement and the use of casting sticks).

119437.description:
Ring of Life is a promo card that will be given out to players that show up to game day locations in February and will likely be made available for sale on the Ascension website at a later date.

From the Card:

Ring of Life
Cost: 4 Runes to acquire
Lifebound Construct
Once per turn, if you have played a Lifebound Hero, gain one Rune.
When Ring of Life enters play, choose a faction. Your heroes of that faction are also Lifebound Heroes.

This card was created as part of an elaborate wedding proposition and later adapted for public distribution.
119437.name: Ascension: Storm of Souls – Ring of Life Promo

119438.name: Autoreise-Spiel
119438.description:
Objective: be the first crossing finish line (110)
- moving by turn -
simple roll & move game
blue fields push you forward, red fields backwards or stop you/ throw you out
remarks:
published early 1930's

119439.name: Boule de Feu
119439.description:
The goal of the game is to reach the dragon of his opponent with his weapons, or eliminate it directly through the Fireball.
Each player takes a dragon, two clubs, two axes, two swords and a ball of fire.
Each dragon launches 2 to 3 meters. Then, each player throws in turn role of a weapon to touch the dragon of his opponent.
A club that hits the dragon of his opponent scores 3 points. a
axe scores 2 points and sword.scores 1 point.
The Fireball attack happens with closed eyes. If it touches the opponent's dragon or one of his weapons opponent is eliminated.

When two players have played all their cards, they count the number of points. Player who wins the three rounds is the winner.

119440.name: Phantasmagoria
119440.description:
The one of Japanese collectible card game that uses the Japanese anime art style. This game's art and theme is base on famous Japanese visual novels (PC games).

The main concept of the game is letting the Character cards join the battle and deal damage to the opponent's Character cards. Knock down 3 of them or an Ace Character card to win the game.

The card types in this game are
Character card, Event card, Item card, Battle card and EX skill card.

Deck construction has 3 parts: Main deck, EX skill deck and an Ace character card. Each player must have at least 60 cards in main deck and a Character card (total 61 cards). Optional, each player may have up to 3 EX skill cards for EX skill deck.

Unlike Magic: The Gathering, the Creature Cards in Magic: The Gathering have 2 values; Power value and Toughness value for attacking and defensing in the game. But in this game's Character cards have 5 values. Each value will be determine which is the Attacking Value or Defense Value by the Battle Cards. 5 Value are Force, Agility, Intelligence, Skill and Tranquility (This is unofficial translated.)
Example, one of Battle card determines Force for attacking and Agility for defensing. In that battle, Force become attacking value (power) and Agility becomes defensing value (toughness).

The huge amount of tokens are necessary to play this game for counting a damage in each Character card.

119441.name: Travellers of the Wasteland
119441.description:
From books introduction:

Travellers of the Wasteland (TOTW) is a fantasy roleplaying
game. It is set in a magical otherworld known as the
Wasteland, a place of mystery, danger, and adventure. This
is a world to be explored, through decision-making and
daring; a fabulous realm as hauntingly familiar and
maddeningly distant as a dream. Watch your step, traveller,
for in your journey through the wasteland you may lose
yourself – or find echoes from a bygone age.
And don’t rely on the sun for finding your path; it moves
from day to day.

119442.name: Megafortress
119442.description:
Megafortress is a flight simulation game released by Three-Sixty Pacific in 1991. The player takes command of the fictional EB-52 Megafortress created by the military and espionage novelist Dale Brown.

The game takes place in the late 1980s and early 1990s and features three distinct sets of missions: Red Flag (USAF) training exercises at Nellis Air Force Base in Nevada, a fictional series of missions during the First Gulf War and a special mission which reenacts the plot of the novel Flight of the Old Dog.

The game is played as a first person flight simulator. The player can control the EB-52 from six stations ranging from the pilot's station to the electronic warfare officer's station.

The player earns promotions from successfully completing missions. The highest rank that can be achieved in the game is brigadier general. If the player completes the special mission, they are immediately promoted to brigadier general.

Source: Wikipedia, "Megafortress", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

Back of the Box

Big, bad, and armed to the teeth!

Megafortress is more than just a battle-scarred B-52. It's the enemy's worst nightmare: a nearly-invisible attacker, carrying enough firepower to destroy the most heavily defended installations in the world.

Forget the run-of-the-flight simulators you're familiar with. Megafortress is in a class by itself: a radically modified B-52H Stratofortress, with radar-absorbing fibersteel skin, an SST nose, and enough state-of-the-art sensing apparatus and weapons systems to jam and blast its way into any place on Earth.

It's a huge, complex aircraft that demands attention to a dizzying array of tasks. Want to know what it's like to deliver 200 tons of mayhem and destruction into the blazing heart of the Iraqi war machine, all the while trying to keep your location a secret? This is the reality of long-range strategic air assault today.

You're not just a Pilot, responsible for takeoff and landing, mid-air refueling and other basic maneuvers. As Navigator you'll plot courses across Iraq and the USSR, keeping your missions on track; as Electronic Warfare Officer you're glued to a radar scope, hunting for threats, jamming signals, keeping the aircraft hidden; as Offensive Weapons Officer you have massive firepower at your disposal: air-to-air missiles, anti-radar missiles, and air mine rockets for defense, and powerful TV/infrared guided glide bombs for the final attack.

With missions in the Persian Gulf and USSR designed by Dale Brown, B-52 navigator and best-selling author, Megafortress is an adventure into the complex world of strategic air assault.

Features


Multi-position bomber simulation with Pilot, Copilot, Navigator, Electronic Warfare Officer, and Offensive Weapons stations.



Complete electronic countermeasures maximize the "stealthiness" of the Megafortress.



Multiple missions in the Desert Storm theater of Iraq/Kuwait, the eastern USSR, and the USAF Red Flag training area in Nevada.



Arsenal includes the latest in air-to-air and air-to-ground missiles, anti-radar missiles, air mine rockets, standard high-explosive "iron" bombs, and TV/infrared glide bombs.



Terrain guidance radar screens operate at realtime speed.



Full 256 color VGA graphics in a 3D world with universal camera angles.



Sound Blaster and AdLib sound support.



Game includes Dale Brown's bestselling novel, Flight of the Old Dog.

119443.name: Raspberry Heaven
119443.description:
subtitle: Heartwarming High School Role-Playing

From the introduction:

Raspberry Heaven is a role-playing game intended for around three to six players. It’s directly inspired by slice of life high school anime and manga, notably Azumanga Daioh, Ichigo Mashimaro, Lucky Star, and Hidamari Sketch, so being familiar with some of those is a big plus. There’s no Game Master or other central authority figure, but at least one of the players should be familiar with the rules before you start playing.

119444.name: Tokyo Heroes
119444.description:
From the introduction:
This game is about heroes. As a player you take on the role of a hero. Somewhere
in the streets of Tokyo a monster—a servant of the terrible Enemy you’ll have to face
one day—is going to hurt innocent people. He must be stopped. Luckily you’re not
alone; you’re part of an elite team with the power to stand up to the bad guys, to find
and extinguish the flame of evil.
This game is specifically about “sentai” heroes. Sentai literally means “fighting
team” in Japanese. It calls to mind Toei’s Super Sentai Series of tokusatsu (live action
special effects) shows that has been going on since 1975, and Power Rangers, the
American adaptation that launched in 1993 and is still going. There are many other
titles, tokusatsu, anime, and otherwise, that it inspired, in Japan and elsewhere.

119445.name: Acquaint
119445.description:
At last, there's a fun new way to avoid the dreaded "awkward silence" when dating someone new! Introducing ACQUAINT™ - the revolutionary "real deal" card game that helps first-, second-, or even third-time daters get better acquainted. It was designed not only to create conversation and calm nerves, but to also help daters better determine each other's "keeper" potentials; needless to say, finding out early on whether or not they are truly compatible may prove to be a time-saving, preventative measure of future heartache.

This highly interactive card game includes questions, tasks, lessons and more! It encourages 'authentic' conversation through the sharing of thoughts, experiences, feelings and values. Questions range from light-hearted topics to semi-personal and serious, and fun "off-the-wall" topics are included throughout.

OBJECT: Collect as many Rose Cards in your hand as you can by discarding as many other cards as possible. Players perform any task(s) listed on the discarded card on each turn. There are a total of 9 Rose Cards, and the player with the most in their hand at the end wins. The main point of the game, however, is for the players to get to know one another better.

CARDS: Includes 52 cards total

9 ROSE CARDS
20 'REAL DEAL' QUESTION CARDS
4 FILL-IN-THE-BLANK CARDS
6 DISCUSSION CARDS
5 SCALE ("What # Are You?") CARDS
6 MISCELLANEOUS CARDS ('Listening Check' Card, 'Deception Destroyer' Card 'Share' Card, 'Flirt' Card, 'Deal Breaker' Card, & 'Compromise' Card)
2 PROTECTION CARDS




START: SHUFFLE CARDS WELL before starting (keeping all the cards facing the same direction). Choose which player will go first. Players must also choose in advance the level of play preferred for the 'REAL DEAL' Questions from the three levels listed below.

REAL DEAL QUESTION CARD LEVELS:

LEVEL 1 ('a' questions) - Simple, light-hearted questions to learn a little about your date - questions that are generally easy to answer and don't take that much thought
LEVEL 2 ('b' questions) - Moderate get-to-know-your-date questions - questions that get a little more serious, where people can reveal a bit more about themselves
LEVEL 3 ('c' questions) - Deep questions designed to create a bonding emotional connection, or, to better spot potential 'RED FLAGS' in advance--ideal for 'bold' daters. Keep in mind DISHONESTY CAN DESTROY EVEN THE BEST OF RELATIONSHIPS! PLAY AT YOUR OWN RISK! Warning: Some questions may be considered to some as personally inappropriate for a new date, even though the questions are in good taste. (The reason someone may pass on a question need not be explained -- besides, a little mystery can often prove to be an effective strategy as well.)




PLAY: Each person is dealt 7 cards (one at a time) face down. The remaining cards are placed face down in a pile in the center of the table, forming the draw pile (or the Selection Pile). The first player (aka THE DISCARDER) takes a turn by drawing the top card from the Selection Pile followed by choosing a card to discard from his/her hand, reading it out loud first. Players then respond to any directions from the card accordingly. When finished, the DISCARDER places the card face up right alongside the Selection Pile, into what will be the Discard Pile (unless otherwise directed). Similarly, the other player then takes their turn, and so on.

SCORING: The game ends as soon as soon as the last card is picked up/discarded. The players then count the number of Rose Cards in their hands, and the player with the most roses wins. (If both players end up without any roses, it's considered a tie game.).

119446.name: Mascot-tan
119446.description:
From designer's website:
Mascot-tan

A Roleplaying Game About
The Cute, Disturbing Adventures
Of Cute, Disturbed Little Girls

Mascot-tan is a weird little RPG where the players take on the roles of anime/manga mascot girls, in the vein of Habanero-tan and the OS Girls, and have wacky little adventures. The game's rules are pretty simple, and intended to help promote an atmosphere of chaos and abuse appropriate to the genre. Action resolution is also handled by playing Janken (Paper-Rock-Scissors), though you could be boring and use six-sided dice instead if you want.

Mascot-tan also introduces the RPG Girls, mascot girls for four of the major RPG systems (as well as one for Mascot-tan itself). Be afraid.

119447.name: Halo: The Covenant War
119447.description:
From the introduction:
Halo: The Covenant War is a tabletop RPG based on Bungie’s Halo series of FPS
games. It uses a variant of Fudge, a free system created by Steffan O’Sullivan. The
complete rules are included here, but if you’re interested in finding out more about the
system and its endless options you can get it online, or there’s a print version published
by Grey Ghost Games. I went with Fudge basically because I’m intimately familiar with
it and know how to make it do what I want. Character creation is radically changed from
any existing Fudge variant, and the default wounding rules are replaced with health
points. For more on Fudge, check out www.fudgerpg.com; there are zillions of different
variant rules that could be plugged into this game if you’re so inclined, especially in the
hardcover Fudge 10th Anniversary Edition.

119448.name: Joe le mineur a dit…
119448.description:
Players mine a minerals from the planets.
In each round, the player must decide which two characters he activate in the order of their choice, to collect the finest collection of precious minerals at he end of the game to be the winner.

There are 4 crew members:

Captain Brown: (may move his rocket on the planet of player choice)
Professor Glumdensen (may transforms one precious stones to another)
Agent X331 (may take a ore card fror each player on the galaxy)
Joe the miner (may draw 2 ore cards)

119449.name: Envoyer:  DSA Spezial 1
119449.description:
user summary

This special issue contains 2 full DSA adventures:

"Schwarzer Traim" a group adventure; 3-4 heroes, lvl 10-15
"Das Geheimnis der Silberfische" a group adventure; 3-5 heroes, lvl 2-4

119450.name: Envoyer: Gnorkl's Gimmicks
119450.description:
This special issue contains a collection of magical (usefull) artifacts for any kind of fantasy RPG.

(user summary)

119451.name: Envoyer: DSA Spezial 2
119451.description:
user summary

This special issue contains 3 DSA adventures:


"Falsche Freunde" a group adventure; 4-5 heores, lvl 5-8
"An der Fähre" a group scenario; 4-6 heroes
"Drachenschlund" a group scenario; 1-4 heroes

119452.name: Speedeebee!
119452.description:
In Speedeebee!, players race to complete challenges presented to them while using – or not using! – the letters rolled on four dice.

Each round players are presented with a challenge on one of the fifty challenge cards; each card has three challenges, and the challenge to be used is determined by the color on the back of the challenge card previously won. Someone reads off the challenge – for example, name something taller than five feet starting with one of the rolled letters – then the player rolls the letter dice. Whoever calls dibs first and names something correctly wins the card; if a player makes a wrong guess, he's penalized one card that he claimed previously.

Whoever has the most cards after going through twenty challenge cards wins!

119453.name: Smart Memo
119453.description:
Object of the game is to find the possible pairs of animals.

Depending on the number of players have 9 to 18 cards face down in front of each participant.
In his turn, a player can turn around:
- two cards in front of him
- one card in front of him and an other card in front of any opponent.

If the two cards are identical, each player can shout "Memo".
The player who shouts first gets the two cards as a reward.

In the event of a tie, the player closest to the active player wins the cards.

The first player who manages to have all the cards in front of him wins.

119454.name: Cut the Zombies: Insanely Addictive!
119454.description:
User Summary

Cut The Zombies: Insanely Addictive! Is a slasher game, your objective is to use your sword to save the world killing all the zombies you can by cutting them while sparing the villagers

119455.name: Inertia: Escape Velocity
119455.description:
"Inertia: Escape Velocity is the spiritual successor to Inertia, a student project out of Southern Methodist University’s game development program (known as The Guildhall at SMU), which was awarded the Grand Prize for non-commercial games in the 2011 Indie Game Challenge this past February. With the creators of the original Inertia now part of the development team at Red Fly Studio, a percentage of proceeds from the sale of Inertia: Escape Velocity will be donated to The Guildhall at SMU.

Highlights of Inertia: Escape Velocity include:

Physics-based platformer: employ a unique anti-gravity element to float, glide, and bounce around deep space environments to collect space junk for ship repair and to unlock new planets.

Console gameplay on mobile devices: with high-quality graphics, intense and challenging levels, and a unique gameplay mechanic, core gamers will appreciate a console gaming experience on a portable platform.

Control settings: the game uses on-screen controls for movement, jumping, and gravity control, but players can also opt to use challenging tilt controls that turn the entire device into the controller.

Inferno levels: for even more of a challenge, players can try their hand at these high-difficulty versions of each level."

Source: The Game Website.

119456.name: Beurk: Le Jeu des crados
119456.description:
Each player receives six cards to start representing parts of the house they will have to go. These cards are visible to all.

Players roll the die and it shows some special displays or challenges when two players meet on the same part of the house.

Example of the challenges:
- One who whistles the strongest
- One who makes the biggest burp
etc. Who wins the challenges gives his card to opponent.

The winner is the one that gets rid of his cards first.

119457.name: Idiot Test
119457.description:
User Summary

Idiot Test is a puzzle game, it presents seemingly easy tests but you are guaranteed to fail them a lot while you laugh your guts out.

119459.name: Ancient Lore I: Dark Whisperer
119459.description:
From publisher blurb:

Smooth talking has been a staple of fantasy settings since the days of Tolkien. And now, you can add a truly sinister master manipulator to your game! Dark Whisperers are masters of guile and cunning. Consumate flatterers, liars, and manipulators, the Dark Whisperer dominates realms and steers kingdoms. And does it all with a few well placed words and suggestions. The mask he wears enables him to slide unnoticed through any crowd, to better his rise to power.

Ancient Lore I - Dark Whisperer details the Dark Whisperer prestige class. This class has 5 levels, and prerequisites include levels as an arcane spell caster.

119460.name: Book of Fools
119460.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Book of Fools is a 74 page D20 book of prestige classes for the Mysaniti Campaign world. All of these prestige classes can readily be converted to fit into almost any campaign world. Twenty prestige classes are found in the Book of Fools, with lots of crunchy bits to make them extra chewy. Come and visit the machinations of the Body Thief upon your players, or maybe you aspire to be a Noble Duelist. Is the fiendish whispering of the Demonic Counselor more to your liking? In any case, come on out and enjoy. There's a prestige class for almost every fantasy gaming occasion.

The Book of Fools includes several pages discussing some new magical items, new deities & domains, and a new category of feats. The Sorcerous Ancestry feats will ensure your sorcerer learns to use his bloodline to power new abilities.

119461.name: Comedia Junior
119461.description:
A French party game for younger audience in which players improvise themed performances in given characters.

Ih his turn player draws a card and try as much as possible to have success with the public with his task. He either must let the others guess a word through mime or speak text aloud, or improvise a sketch, or depict a scene with a partner.
Can be played in teams.

The most successful player/team is the winner.

119462.name: Biggles: Adventures in Time
119462.description:
User Summary

A 80's video game based on the youth-oriented adventure books series Biggles and the 1986 movie 'Biggles: Adventures in Time'.

The game offers a combination of platform levels and flight simulation. Set in WW 1 and 1986 London, help Biggles and his twin brother get to photograph a German scret weapon. In the second part of the game the player can fly a helicopter on the western front in 1917!

119463.description: "THE TROOPS HAVE BEEN DEPLOYED. YOUR ORDERS, SIR?" Drums & Shakos Large Battles is a set of miniatures rules for large napoleonic battles. Each player controls a Division of two or three Brigades. Designed to be played in less than three hours, its mechanics force participants to make tactical choices. Drums & Shakos Large Battles rewards good management of reserves, right deployment of artillery, and historical use of cavalry. Maneuver your Battalions and Regiments, react to your opponent's actions, and launch the final attack at the right moment! Victory lies only a few steps away... Innovative mechanics detail the approach and contact phases of combat. Easy measuring system, very limited use of counters and markers, no bookkeeping. Clear victory conditions, based on losses and penetration into enemy territory. The rules allow for reactions in the opponent's turn: no player is ever truly inactive. Four Scenarios included. Appendix: playing at Corps or Army level. Playable in any scale, 6 to 28 mm. Divisional army lists for major powers (Austria, France, Britain, Prussia, Russia, and Spain). Simple guidelines to refight historical battles.
119463.name: Drums and Shakos Large Battle

119464.name: Tier auf Tier: Jetzt geht's rund!
119464.description:
It's time to stack more animals, but as the title suggests, now you move around, too!

In Tier auf Tier: Jetzt geht's rund!, a crocodile is trying to drift peacefully across the ocean, but unfortunately for it, you and the other players each control a bunch of animals that want to go for an ocean cruise, so you'll take turns stacking animals on the crocodile's back. The ocean waves don't let the crocodile drift peacefully, however, and after each animal is placed, the player must rotate the crocodile on its turntable – taking care to watch out for the shark at the same time.

Whoever first stacks all of her animals on the crocodile's back wins!

119465.name: Grand Prix
119465.description:
Objective: be the first to pass finish line (field 90)
- moving by turn -
simple 'Roll & Move' game
ending on a marked space follow instructions...
remark:
published ~ late 60's/early 70's

119467.name: Echoes of the Past: The Citadels of Time
119467.description:
Travel from the Dark Middle Ages to the present to save the inhabitants of the Orion kingdom in Echoes of the Past - The Citadels of Time! The witch is back and is more powerful and inventive than ever! After trapping you in a time limbo, you must use your Hidden Object Puzzle Adventure talents to escape and save the day! The fate of the kingdom is in your hands in Echoes of the Past – The Citadels of Time!

Source: The Publisher Website.

119468.name: Kuck Ruck Zuck!
119468.description:
The animals at the zoo are tired of constantly having to pose for photographs again and again, so they decide to steal a camera and take pictures of themselves to make the process more fun. Can you tell who has the camera?

In Kuck Ruck Zuck! you can't see which animals holds the camera – but you do have the snapshots as evidence of where the camera was, and by looking at the pictures you can tell which animals took which shot. But can you figure out which critter took which pic before anyone else?

119469.name: Der Weg zum Haus
119469.description:
Objective: be the first to acquire a house
- moving by turn -
simple 'Roll & Move' promotional game
starting in the centre of the board you have to finish a circle, draw event cards, acquire a 'Hypo-Beraterstein' before you may cross over to the following (outer) circle; repeat this procedure until you reach the very last circle;
here yor may buy a house...
remark:
promotional edition 'Hypobank'

119470.name: Echoes of the Past: Royal House of Stone
119470.description:
Having made an incredible journey in time, you’ll find yourself in the medieval kingdom of Orion. Reveal an ancient curse and save the kingdom and its inhabitants. The last prince of Orion is waiting for your help! Open the weird locks and explore every room of the castle in Echoes of the Past: Royal House of Stone. You will meet the castle’s inhabitants and learn the horrible mystery of the royal family in this exciting Hidden Object Adventure game.

Source: The Publisher Website.

119471.description:
Wally Walrus' island is a bright treasure, and only the shining light in the lighthouse keeps the water rats away from its shores. Wait, what's this? The light has gone out?! Now the rats have set sail for the island in their boat – they're not stupid water rats, mind you – and it's up to you and your fellow builders to ward them off.

To do this, players in Wasserratten in Sicht! will construct additional lighthouses brick by brick by rolling the right combinations of colors on the dice available to them. Can they get the lights to shine in time and keep the rats from overrunning the island and snacking on Wally's whiskers?

Wasserratten in Sicht! includes a competitive variant.
119471.name: Wasserratten in Sicht!

119472.description: Konito? can be played individually or in teams, the idea being to complete the fill-in-the-blank statements on the game cards in order to move forward on the modular scoring board. (The length of the game is determined by how many sections are used to create the board.) There is a time limit to complete each card, and the game includes more than 1600 phrases and three levels of difficulty.
119472.name: Konito?

119474.description: Act Too, a.k.a. Mimtoo, is a simple game of miming and gestures that is played in teams. One player on the active team draws both a character card and an action card, then silently acts out the card combination – for example, an electrician dancing the polka. This player's teammates have one minute to guess the answer, collecting a card if they do so. The team that collects the most cards wins!
119474.name: Act Too

119475.name: Otherworld: Spring of Shadows
119475.description:
Use a mystical locket to explore a magical world and save a young girl in Otherworld: Spring of Shadows! After buying a quaint house in the country side, you embark on an incredible adventure. With help from magical creatures, find and save Fiona before it's too late! Find the menacing shadow that took Fiona and return her to our world. Solve inventive puzzles and discover secrets in Otherworld: Spring of Shadows, a fun Hidden Object Puzzle Adventure game.

Source: The Publisher Website.

119476.name: House of 1000 Doors: Family Secrets
119476.description:
Guide Kate Reed as she solves four mind-bending mysteries that take her to worlds she's never imagined in House of 1000 Doors: Family Secrets! When the dead cannot find release, the House of 1000 Doors serves as a portal that allows the living to help them. Communicate with spirits and meet the mysterious Lancasters family that resides within the spooky house in this incredible Hidden Object Puzzle Adventure game!


Communicate with the spirits
Travel to other worlds
Solve mind-bending mysteries!


Source: The Publisher Website.

119477.name: Magical Diary: Horse Hall
119477.description:
You have been invited to attend a magical school. Here you can make new friends, learn dozens of spells, face exams in the school dungeons, run for class office, and try to find a date for the May Day Ball.

But be careful! You might end up in detention, be lured into a secret society, be forced to marry your professor, or even be expelled!

Every puzzle has multiple solutions, and the path you choose is up to you. Are you a good witch or a bad witch?

Source: The Publisher Website.

119478.name: Dominium
119478.description:
From the back of the box:

At the outer edge of the Galaxy, DOMINIUM awaits you, ready to organize resistance against the invading troops of the spine-chilling Baron Kraal.

The targets of the invaders are seven nuclear cores hidden in the seven planets of the DOMINIUM system.

Your task is to discover and exploit new sources of energy, which will give you the ability to build and operate dozen of different units of land and space defense against the invader, and at the same time discover the forgotten planets.

DOMINIUM is an explosive mixture of Wargame, Simulation and Strategy.

It will confront you with an infinity of different situations, in a universe as enthalling as any of the finest Science Fiction.

- 10.000 game configurations
- 5 levels of difficulty
- 1 or 2 players by serial/modem connection
- is played entirely by mouse !
- is a game in constant animation

119479.name: Midnight Mysteries: Haunted Houdini
119479.description:
When Houdini’s promises of contact from beyond go unkept, his wife comes to you in a final plea to unravel his mysterious passing in Midnight Mysteries: Haunted Houdini Deluxe! When he promised his wife that he would try to reach her from the afterlife, it was seen as the ultimate stunt But after years of séances, Bess was never able to reach Harry in this life or the next, and her spirit has come to you in a final plea to reunite her with her partner!

Deluxe games include an Integrated Strategy Guide!


Meet other apparitions
Help Bess contact her love
Unravel Houdini’s mysterious death!


Source: The Publisher Website.

119480.name: Shadoworlds
119480.description:
From the back of the box:

On the three planets of the Magna 6 system you have set up a modest research facility. Nothing too extreme. Just a few personnel, a Galaxy-class space station and the most powerful weapons development facility the Universe has ever known.

But now you have a problem. The regular daily contact schedule on the sub-space station network with Magna 6 has gone a bit quiet. Well, silent actually. In fact, you have had no word from the facility in 2 months.

You need to send trusted yet expendable men in to get answers and carry out a discreet efficient operation.

Pick your four man team and "Deep Sleep", the cryogenic computer will keep them in suspended animation until they arrive at Magna 6, an interstellar journey of almost 17 months. And then wait for their report. But what possible explanation could there be for trouble on Magna 6 - there is no power in the universe capable of disturbing the facility. The known universe, that is.

119481.name: The Mummy Mystery
119481.description:
From the back of the box:

It's Little Monster Private Eye To The Rescue!

Join Little Monster Private Eye and his sidekick Detective Kerploppus as they explore ancient Monster Egypt to rescue Professor Pickle. From the tombs of Tootafroota and Pharaoh Phaucett to the Lost City of Harmonrya, it's an adventure-style game filled with humor as dry as the desert. There are games to play, puzzles to solve and great characters to interact with as you search for the legendary magic rings and save the professor.

119482.name: Shadow Force: Razor Unit
119482.description:
From the back of the box:

Rid the world of terrorism!

You're part of the ELITE SHADOW FORCE UNIT that has been selected to rip out the heart of global terrorism. You've been dropped behind enemy lines to find the mission bungled beyond belief!

Freedom and Democracy are counting on you!!!

Choose from a wide selection of the military's most advanced weaponry and dig in for the fight of your life!!

119483.name: Hareraiser: Prelude
119483.description:
Hareraiser is a computer game, originally released in 1984 in the UK for most home computer platforms. It was released in two parts; Prelude and Finale. The game takes the form of a series of graphical screens depicting grass, sky and trees with occasional text 'clues'. There are no hints as to how the puzzle can be solved but presumably, the position of the trees, sun, clouds etc

A prize worth £30,000 was on offer if the game could be solved. It was released in two parts; Prelude and Finale. The solvers of Prelude would also then have to buy and solve Finale. They could then enter a competition to locate the prize, the bejewelled 18 carat "Golden Hare" pendant as featured on the cover. Hareraiser was never solved, and the hare was sold at a Sotheby's auction by the creditors in 1988.

Source: Wikipedia, "Hareraiser", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

119485.name: Find the Goggles
119485.description:
This game is based on the film “Finding Nemo,” specifically the scene in which Dori and Nemo’s father find the goggles at the bottom of the sea. Players play as the two fish and need to get the goggles.

This is a print and play game. The pdf includes the following components:
-cards
-goggles token
-special dice
-board

Players will need to prepare the following component (not included in the pdf):
-a normal 6-sided dice

Players roll a special dice to determine one’s movement. When you reach an “Info” box, you roll the normal dice and it determines the place of the goggles.

The player who gets to the goggle space the fastest is the winner.

119487.name: Night at the Museum: Battle of the Smithsonian The Video Game
119487.description:
Get ready for a story so epic it could only unfold in the corridors of the world's largest museum--the Smithsonian Institution. Museum guard-turned entrepreneur Larry Daley discovers that his favorite exhibits, and some of his best friends, from New York's Natural History Museum are being shipped off to the archives at the Smithsonian. Larry gets a distress call from the miniature cowboy, Jedediah, reporting that Egyptian ruler Kahmunrah and a trio of heinous henchmen--namely Ivan the Terrible, Napoleon and Al Capone--are plotting to take over the museum, then the world. Speeding to the nation's capitol, Larry is clearly in over his head. But with some impressive new pals, including the irrepressible Amelia Earhart, along with familiar friends Teddy Roosevelt and Octavius, Larry will stop at nothing to restore the Smithsonian before dawn.

- Extend the movie experience! Play as Larry Daley, inventor and bumbling night guard at the Museum of Natural History, where the exhibits come alive at night! Ben Stiller's voice and likeness are included in the game for an authentic experience.
- Meet and interact with the cast of wacky museum exhibits including historical figures like Amelia Earhart and Teddy Roosevelt along with dinosaurs and polar bears
- Battle history's greatest villains, from Al Capone to Napoleon to Ivan the Terrible
- Adventure through 14 levels within The Smithsonian, from the Federal Archives to the National Air and Space Museum, the Lincoln Memorial and many more.
- Take control of out of this world vehicles: pilot the Lunar Lander, Pitcairn Autogyro and T Rex skeleton
- Use your trusty Key Chain and Flashlight to solve puzzles and make your way through the museums
- Collect all of the pieces of the Magic Tablet of Ahkmenrah to unlock new levels, solve puzzles and more
- Collect a huge variety of pick-ups to unlock features, mini-games and bonus content
- Stuck in an area? Use the Eye of Horus hint system to reveal important areas that may just help you keep going
- Check out all of your accomplishments in the Award Room
- Real Smithsonian content includes trivia questions, in game audio tours and factoids

Source: The Publisher Website.

119488.name: Ninja Reflex
119488.description:
Ninja Reflex is a party game, capitalizing on the popularity of games that take advantage of the unique Nintendo Wii Remote motions seen in other titles including WarioWare: Smooth Moves, Mario Party 8, and Wii Sports. The game supports up to four players.

The object of Ninja Reflex is to test players' reflexes and reaction times and challenge friends in head-to-head competition.

Source: Wikipedia, "Ninja Reflex", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

119489.name: PlayStation Controller
119489.description:
The PlayStation Controller is the first gamepad released by Sony Computer Entertainment for its PlayStation video game console. The original version (model SCPH-1010) was released alongside the PlayStation on December 3, 1994.

Based on the basic button configuration established with Nintendo's Super NES Controller, the PlayStation Controller added a second pair of shoulder buttons for the middle fingers. Intended to update the gamepad for navigating 3D environments such as the ones PlayStation was designed to generate, the concept behind featuring shoulder buttons for both the index and middle fingers was to implement two-way directional depth controls using the two sets of buttons. To compensate for the less stable grip from shifting the middle fingers' placement to the shoulders, grip handles were added to the controller.

Using the simple geometric shapes Triangle, Circle, Cross, and Square to label its action buttons rather than traditionally used letters or numbers, the PlayStation Controller established a trademark which would be incorporated heavily into the PlayStation brand. In an interview with Teiyu Goto, designer of the original Playstation Controller, he explains what the symbols mean. The circle and x represent yes and no respectively, the triangle symbolizes a point of view and the square is equated to a sheet of paper there to be used to access menus.

On April 2, 1996, Sony released a revised version of the PlayStation Controller (model SCPH-1080), featuring a longer cord with a ferrite bead. After briefly selling the Dual Analog Controller in 1997, Sony began phasing out the PlayStation Controller later that year with the introduction of the DualShock controller, which would become the new standard controller for the PlayStation.

Source: Wikipedia, "PlayStation Controller", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

119490.name: PlayStation Memory Card
119490.description:
The original memory card for the Playstation holds 128 kB of space in an EEPROM.

Source: Wikipedia, "PlayStation (console)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

119491.name: Double Fine Happy Action Theater
119491.description:
Happy Action Theater is an open-ended game, providing eighteen different modes that incorporate features of the Kinect motion-sensing and camera system. Players can select any one of the eighteen modes, or opt to have the game randomly select modes and cycle through them every few minutes. The game can support the tracking of up to 6 players.

Within most modes there are no goals, only to perform certain actions for the Kinect as to create humorous results in a form of augmented reality on the console's display. For example, one mode simulates a flow of lava that fills the player's room on the game's screen, and depicts the player within it. From here, the player can kick at rocks that float on the lava, interact with small animated flame sparks that jump around, or by "immersing" themselves in the lava, can have their hands temporarily shoot fireballs to "wipe out" other players on screen for a short period of time. Another mode simulates Space Invaders, with the players required to hold their hands up and move about as to destroy attacking forces on screen; while a score is kept, the mode is endless. The game does include a limited number of achievements for certain actions.

Source: Wikipedia, "Happy Action Theater", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

119492.name: Summoning Powers
119492.description:
Publisher's Blurb:

Why do all of the difficult and dangerous work yourself when you can summon up someone—or something— else to do it for you? Summoning Powers are all about agents, non-player characters called up by Summon effects, and what you can do with them. It covers conventional minions from infernal demons to animated machines but also powers like duplication, combined forms, empowering, and anatomic separation! This product is for Mutants & Masterminds Third Edition.

119493.description:
The ancient origins of a civilized sport. Play Test, Limited Over or Twenty20 versions of the game at its most hallowed amphitheater.
The Gentleman’s game of Cricket originated in England, is played on a circular arena, and since a Trilithon resembles an ancient giant set of cricket stumps, anthropologists have recently hypothesized that Stonehenge may actually have been built as an ancient cricket ground. One look at a photo of Dr. W. G. Grace should provide further proof of Druidic involvement in the sport.
This game is for the Stonehenge Game System
119493.name: Stonehenge Cricket

119494.description:
The Druid Council has become weakened through in-fighting and years of drought. The leader of each Druidic chapter races to seize control of the council and assume power as Chief Druid. Upon establishing command he unleashes a team of assassins to eliminate his political enemies, and become the unopposed Supreme Grand Chief Druid.

This game is based on the ancient African (Baggara Arabs of the Sudan) game of Li’b el Merafib or Hyena, which may have been based upon an unknown ancient Druidic game, which may have been based upon actual events at Stonehenge.

For the Stonehenge Game System
Players race around the board, the first to reach the council seizes power. They then unleash assassins to hunt down the other players. After all political rivals have been purged or exiled, the winner flaunts their status with a huge victory rally.
119494.name: Night of the Bloody Sickles

119495.name: GameShark
119495.description:
GameShark is the brand name of a line of video game cheat cartridges and other products for a variety of console video game systems and Windows based computers. Currently, the brand name is owned by Mad Catz, who actively markets GameShark products for the PlayStation, Xbox, Nintendo, and Sega game consoles. Players load cheat codes from Gameshark disks or cartridges onto the console's internal or external memory then the game is loaded and the selected cheats are applied.

Source: Wikipedia, "GameShark", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

119496.description:
F-16 Fighting Falcon is a tactical level air combat wargame in modern warfare. Players control the few jet fighters. The game performs in two steps of changes of flight status and actual move on the board. Flight status is represent five levels of attitude and pitch. It works to control easily the change of altitude and turning.

This game covers only air to air combat, and does not include ground attack. Victory conditions vary by scenarios. For example, shooting down enemy aircraft.

This game was designed for wargame beginners.
119496.name: F-16 Fighting Falcon

119497.name: Thorwal Standard (Issue 15 - May 2001)
119497.description: This issue contains the first part of the adventure "Stunde der Rache" and articles about shipping and cannon building in Thorwal.

119498.description:
This is self-published expansion kit for Kyushu Sangokushi.
Ryukyu is old name of Okinawa islands, and "Wind of Ryukyu" is title of a Japanese historical fiction television series.

Covering battles in Okinawa island. Two scenarios are included in this kit.

Each players control one or more clans. The clan's combat units is organized to some troops.
The game repeats the game turn decided by the scenario. There are four action stages in each game turn. The number of stages where each troop can act is decided by commander's activation ability. In the action stage, each troop selects one action. The action that can be selected is a movement, field combat, siege, moral recovery, reorganization and replacement.

Victor is determined by the capture or defend of the castle given scenario.

Also need to play Standard rule (Late version), Reference card and some markers from Kyushu Sangokushi.
119498.name: Wind of Ryukyu

119499.name: Bankir
119499.description: In this Swedish trivia game players take turns being the "Bankir". The "bankir" is selling question cards to the other players with three headlines. Then the "bankir" is drawing a letter and every player has two minutes to fins out a words that match the headlines on their card. If you finish your cards you can buy more from the bankir. If you answer correclty you get money from the bank and the one with the most money in the end wins.

119500.name: Wanna Bet?
119500.description:
From the publisher:
In this hilarious family game, players are challenged to perform different kinds of tasks while other players bet whether or not they can succeed in them. If the others guess correctly, they receive the amount of game money they bet as a reward, whereas you get a reward if you perform the task without failing. Wanna Bet? is an excellent addition to all game nights. Its interactive nature and hilarious content make it an instant hit with both adults and children!
